description:
This place is really great. Authentic, rich flavors, beautiful presentation, generous portions, and friendly owners/waitstaff. Totally delicious. So happy to have this place in the Richmond!

Some favorites: chicken fenugreek, lamb biriyani (the accompanying raita is so smooth and flavorful), palak paneer, mattar paneer.

You can't go wrong. Thank you, Keeva!
author: Celeste B.

description:
Came for a quick dinner on Sunday with two other friends around 7 pm. We were in a rush but the restaurant accommodated our schedule and we were able to get the food and eat quickly.

First thing you notice when you walk in was that even though it's a small-ish place, there are really cute decorations everywhere. It's a great neighborhood spot.

The food is pretty affordable as well. Most of the curries were in the $12-15 range. I was going to get a curry until I found out about the special of the night, which was tandoori fish ($25.99). I've never seen this dish before so decided to try it out. The fish they used was pompano.

Before ordering, I asked if it was spicy and they assured me it wasn't, but I have extremely low spice tolerance and it ended up being a little bit too spicy. I still managed to eat it though, just slowly and with plenty of rice. They only give one small scoop of rice to eat with the whole fish, which isn't nearly enough. I ran out of rice about halfway through the fish, especially because I was eating extra to balance out the spicy flavors. Also, I wish they had mentioned the price earlier when telling us about the special, as it was pricier than expected.

Presentation was really nice though, especially given the casual and home-y environment of the restaurant. That was a pleasant surprise.
author: Dianna H.

description:
Food was disappointing. The palak paneer and tarka dal we ordered - medium spicy lacked flavor - both dishes were super low on salt leave alone any other flavors.
Tandoori roti was thick and undercooked.
Highly disappointing meal overall.
author: Nikita T.

description: Amazing food, great service. Loved the egg curry and chettinad lamb. Highly recommend it.
author: Chet L.

description: Absolutely loved the food. One of those few places where the flavours in each preparation are distinct. All curries are not just a version of the tikka masala gravy. The food is slightly spicy ( in a good way ) and very flavoursome. And unlike most other indian restaurants the curry here is not floating in a lot of oil. I highly recommend this place for the quality of Indian food.
author: Rutika D.

description:
I am in love with the Indian Kitchen.  We used to have a tradition before, every Saturday we went out to an Indian Restaurant. I was impressed when my manager told about Keeva Indian Kitchen I was not thinking that the food here is so good. I like the Indian food for their spicy feature and all the seasonings. 
I ordered Samosa ($6), Chicken Tikka Masala ($13.95) and a Coconut Fish Curry ($14,5). Good prices! 
Thank you for an awesome service and delicious food!
author: Elena L.

description:
3.5 STARS

After drinking a little too much the night before and spending all day out and about (primarily doing a non drinking activity), I needed food. Indian is my comfort food when feeling a little delicate, so I decided to get delivery for dinner. I placed an order on Saturday, March 17th at 6:24pm. It arrived at 7:01pm. I live in Outer Richmond. Even though I was dining solo, I asked the roommate what he wanted and ordered for him as well.

*Samosa: Puff pastry stuffed with potatoes and english peas ($6)
*Breads ($2.75): Garlic Nan (+$0.75) x2, Onion Nan (+$1.20)
*Chicken Tikka Masala: Tandoor grilled chicken cooked in creamy tomato sauce with smokey flavor ($13.95)
*Chicken Vindaloo: Spices soaked in vinegar cooked with spices, a goan delicacy ($13.50)

I adored the chicken vindaloo. So much flavor. And it had a good subtle heat. I tend to like my tikka masala a little creamier, so I didn't enjoy this one as much as the vindaloo. Judging from the pix, maybe I should have had the butter chicken instead. The naan was soft with a nice chew. But I didn't get much onion or garlic flavor in either one. Still, a good vehicle for the curries I ordered. I'm not eating fried foods at the moment, so I couldn't try the samosas. But the roomie seemed to enjoy them. Especially with the vindaloo. I used the mint chutney for my curry and nan.

I've been wanting to try Keeva for some time, so I'm glad I finally did. Their vindaloo is excellent! I've read good things about their tandoori chicken. Next time the Indian craving hits, maybe I'll try that.
author: Elena N.

description: I found this pretty disappointing. Especially because it was one of the highest rated places on here. I got one of the spicier dishes on the menu and Id say it was like a 2/10 on spice level and tasted similar to Trader Joe's ... I'll stick to Naan and curry Castro.. their environment isn't as fancy but the food is authentic
author: Lucas T.

description:
Bad delivery and customer service!  Ordered some food for delivery and didn't receive everything.  Called Keeva and they said they don't deliver.  But the woman who answered the call passed the call to a man.  I asked him if he was the driver and he said yea.  So Keeva do use their own driver.  Gave him a fat tip, too. So bad service and also a liar.  They told me to call grubhub as they are responsible for redelivery.  Grubhub couldnt help me because they said the missing order needed to be at least $20 for redelivery.

Keeva, you should accept responsibility for your mistakes.  Double fucking check orders before you give them to your driver to deliver.
author: Julius M.

description:
The interior of the restaurant is warm and vibrant with artwork, pillows, flowers, and ornaments filling the space with lively colors. After walking from Ocean Beach to Golden Gate and then across the bridge and back in that day's lovely weather, my friend and I were exhausted and ravenous. We still had some time to spare before the restaurant opened so my friend parked at the edge of Golden Gate Park which is a great stretch of road to park on because you don't have to worry if the space is big enough so that you're not blocking anyone's garage. From there we walked to Clement. 

I ordered two of my favorites: Palak Chaat and Mattar Paneer. The Palak Chaat was very gratifying with each bite full of texture and flavor. I am still in awe of this way of preparing spinach. The portion was the perfect size for me. The Mattar Paneer had an intense sunflower seed flavor that left a strong impression. It was a little disappointing that there were only two or so slices of paneer. And I would have preferred a thicker consistency. That and the lack of paneer made the Mattar Paneer more like a soup. I did end up being quite full and satisfied from what I ordered.
author: Lauren H.

description:
We really wanted to like Keeva, esp. considering all the rave Yelp reviews. Unfortunately we felt let down and left with a broken promise.

Here's the dig. All the best Indian restaurants are in South Bay. You need a sizable Indian diaspora to demand high quality and adequately spiced Indian food and not a concept of Indian food or fusion Indian food.

The service is great - super friendly and chatty. Prices are 70% higher than South Bay, but you can't put a price on really good food -except this wasn't worth the premium.

We tried a bunch of entrees after seeking recommendations. First off the biryani was over cooked rice and lacked flavor. Although we were spoilt by Hyderabad Dum Biryani and other South Bay staples, this one fell flat. The next best place is India Beach restaurant near Half Moon Bay.

We tried the paneer (cottage cheese) dish and the paneer was rubbery. The dish was so under spiced that we wondered if this was closer to hospital food than Indian food - OK that's a bit of a stretch but you get the drift.

The challenge isn't that the food was terrible, it wasn't, we just had high expectations, esp, since we have been exposed to a lot of great Indian food in the US and on our trips to India. 

I wouldn't go there again. The prices and food quality do not justify a second visit, however they may be having a bas day, so you may want to take a chance and convince us to go again.
author: Sam K.

description:
Found my new favorite local Indian spot!

Sauces had amazing flavor and heat, and the meats were executed nicely. Had goat curry, chicken tikka masala, and aloo gobi, and finished with a warm, moist gulab jamun (my favorite Indian dessert).

The owners stopped by and were so friendly and welcoming. The ambiance is warm and pretty. Looking forward to returning soon!
author: Thuan N.

description:
One of the best places for Indian food in sf. 
I tried their chicken tikka masala and garlic naan and I felt like I am back to punjab. 
The host are really friendly and the place is very homely. 
My friend tried the samosas and they looked freshly made. 
Desi guys says go for it.
author: Kuber D.

description: It was my fault for not telling them I like my food spicy, BUT, I found the food entirely without taste, let alone spice. Even a little salt would have gone a long way.
author: Sharanya N.

description:
Go to spot to curb indian cravings!
I am very picky when it comes to a good curry and I was pleasantly surprised at Keeva! If you love okra, this is the place to go. We also ordered palak chat, dal makhni, veg biryani and a paneer makhni. Everything was delicious, nicely presented but the portions were rather small for the price.

The owner is very personable, she was checking every table about the food and making recommendations.

Parking is easier in Richmond as is expected.
author: Nidhi M.

description: This is the best Indian food I've ever had! I'm so excited to have found Keeva! The flavors are fresh and thoughtful  and I was so happy I did a little dance in my seat Lol if you are in San Francisco you have to check Keeva out.
author: Chris R.

description:
I like Indian food a lot, my perspective is that of someone born and raised in the bay area who has never been to India or ate authentic Indian food prepared in someone's home... But I've eaten the version of Indian food I'm familiar with around here at many different restaurants. 
Who cares, but I'm qualifying my next statement. This is the best I've had. Glad to have them in the neighborhood.
author: Kyle S.

description:
The food is fabulous and the hospitality is off the charts.
If you're in the inner Richmond neighborhood this is a must stop. Hell, even if you're not it's well worth the trip
author: Jose R.

description:
I tried this place on recommendation from a fellow yelper. Mostly it's good. I like the food 
Hara bhara kabab was excellent
Guibger pepper soup was really bad. It was watery and chicken had no flavor
For main course, Malai kofta , kadhai paneer very pretty good. Naan and kulcha were crispy, just they way I like it. Hence the four stars.
Chai was pretty decent as well. Thank God for no cinnamon in the tea :)
author: Neha G.

description:
Great comfort food. friendly staff. Good atmosphere. Positive vibes! 
This place is well suited for both a quick work day dinner and/or an evening dinner date. Its like a Patagonia R2 midlayer - good for travel, running, the mountains and for work! You don't have to be formally dressed up to go here. But you may be underdressed if you forgot your trousers at home. 

-Chicken tikka masala: Melt in your mouth perfection. it was not perfectly balanced, not heavy. it was not greasy. portion size was just right. Nailed the seasoning and the spices. I can have this all day long, every day. 6/5 stars. yep 6/5 not 5/5.

- Ambience: The best part about this place is you can walk in and walk out without your clothes smelling of grimy oily fried curry powder, unlike other Indian restaurants. well ventilated, Ambience 5/5

-Chicken Biryani: Long grain rice/oily/ ummmm.... but wait......................where's the chicken, there's only rice here? 2/5 stars

-Malai Chicken Kabab: Under cooked, under seasoned, huge pieces. It was served when I was almost done with my meal. 2/5 stars. Very disappointing. 

-Naan: Soaked in butter, but soft. Could do another 10 seconds more in the tandoor and a whole cube less of the butter, 3/5 stars. 

$55 is reasonable for SF standards. But the food is not really cheap either. especially when it can easily be executed and timed to perfection. Why did the malai kababs come out when i was almost done with my meal? That's a rookie move and one messes up the entire meal. 

Think about it, the main course comes out - piping hot and tasty. you start eating and then the appetizer arrives when you're almost done - huh ? wait should i pause eating the main course, let it get cold and dig into the appetizer ??? uh, i don't think so.  

I was not offered a cancellation on the malai kabab despite leaving the full portion and all pieces on the table. this cannot be boxed up and eaten the next day because its best had fresh from the tandoor. 

I like this place but I left with an unpleasant feeling of having wasted ~ $15 on those malai tikkas.  It won't stop me from being back - That chicken tikka masala was a true delight.
author: Raj R.

description: Enjoyed the visit. My second time here. Food is of good quality. The Bang Bang egg curry is a signature dish that's worth ordering.
author: Divye K.

description: Well, this small family owned place is a gem. We ordered vegetable biryani as main course that was amazingly low spiced unlike many other South Asian restaurants you will encounter in the Bay Area. Samosas were also freshly prepared. They were super crispy outside and super soft inside. After eating our food, we ordered Ghulab Jamun as a dessert that was again really nice. The only bit is their price. While $17 is justifiable for a biryani, $6 for a couple of small samosas or ghulab jamun is a bit of an overkill. Please review them.
author: Qasim Z.

description: Amazing! We loved every bite! My husband and I spent the afternoon riding our bikes across the Golden Gate and drinking coffee in Sausalito. When we came back into the city we were hungry! We Yelped for an Indian restaurant and Keeva was the first on the list. I read 20+ reviews and we decided to try it. Incredible! My husband isn't into Indian food. He loved it! He said he would drive back to city for it. Well now let's talk about the food. Oh my! You must get the okra, baby eggplant and chicken curry chettinand. The okra was perfectly prepared and the chef used petit okra so they were so tender. Same with the baby eggplant! The flavor! The service was amazing! Our waitress was adorable and talked to us like we were old friends. Go to Keeva tonight!
author: Molly C.

description: Great! Liked the service and the environment. Everything was perfect.
author: Harold T.

description: Just came here for the weekend, and I love the Indian food, and I tried Bang Bang Egg Curry and it was very delicious.
author: Tatiana V.

description:
Nice place nestled in the heart of actual china town.
We ordered panner makhani, dal and some aloo gobi. All of them were perfect. The naan was soft and fluffy.
I don't recommend the mango lassi. 
All the curries had a perfect flavor to it.
If you are heading over to golden gate from 280 route, this is a great stop to have some Indian food.
author: Avinash R.

description:
Keeva is a treasure.  We were very impressed by both the quality of the food and the service.  It rates four stars...perhaps even 4.5 stars, which we cannot award due to the limitation of Yelp.

Soup:  We found the Ginger Pepper Chicken soup flavorful, with a good amount of depth, and the chicken morsels were tender and juicy.

The samosa was not the usual breadcrumb-filled bland mouth-drying affair found in so many Indian (Bengali, Pakistani, Sikh etc.,) restaurants.  This samosa is juicy, with a moist interior filled with vegetables and very flavorful.  The outside was crisp, with its own unique flavor but not doughy

The Lamb Roganjosh was outstanding along with the Aloob Gobi Masala (cauliflower and potato in tomato ginger).  The lamb is NOT the usual bony lamb, nor does this lamb even hint at gristle so often found in cheaper cuts of lamb so often encountered elsewhere.  You'll find the meat dishes here plump, tender, juicy and tasty.

A real winner is the Indian Eggplant in Salan sauce.  Shaped like large Jalapeño peppers but darker skinned, the Indian Eggplant is succulent, with a touch of firmness, yet soft and inviting to bite into!  Now, add the salan sauce, and coupled with rice, makes a fabulous mouth-watering treat.

The nan is also excellent...a touch greasy on the outside, but moist, tender, with just the slightest hint of crispness here and there.

Food is spiced as follows: Mild, moderate and hot.  We found the mild to be easy to eat, perhaps maybe a touch too spicy for those whose palates are very sensitive.  Another visit, and we chose "moderate"...which was a touch spicy for us, but not enough that we were craving water nor needed to mop our brows.  Moderate was in fact, just a touch hotter than mild, which really isn't that hot.  (We've been to places where moderate would have you exhaling flames).  

The decor isn't fancy...it's kind of diner-restaurant like, but the place is clean.  On a scale of 0-10, it's a 5-5.5.  (2 or less would be a dump, which this establishment is clearly NOT).  We found parking outside easy, never parking more than 1/2 block away.  We are unsure of what transportation is nearby.  Service is good...fantastic when the place is empty, but effective when crowded.  We found the service person inviting, friendly and helpful in making decisions about what might best to eat.
author: Robert G.

description:
I LOVE THIS PLACE! One time I came here 2-3 times in a week. 

I absolutely love the Palak Chaat here for the appetizer and I always get the paneer makhani + garlic naan (I can't eat spicy food, and this sauce is amazingly flavored). 

Highly recommended!
author: Natasha S.

description:
Come here for THE best Indian food in town! Also, if you're looking for a dinner + show, you need to meet the owner Rita. She truly defines what it means to have great service from a small, family-run business. There's no way you can miss her - she's the jolly one bouncing around from table to table, making sure everyone's having a great lunch/dinner + great time. Shout out to Rita! 

The restaurant's interior is on the smaller side, but I've seen groups of up to 8+ get seated before (there's a larger table in the back). Most of the tables seat a party of 4, and this spot will get packed after 6pm. So if you hate waiting as much as I do, come earlier! Or sweet talk Rita...jk, that doesn't actually work. I think. Haha. 

Now let's get to the star of the show...the food! I'm pretty sure I've tried everything off the menu that I can eat (so minus all the meat), and I'm not joking when I say you cannot go wrong with anything on the menu. My personal favs are the coconut fish curry, spinach paneer veggie curry (or maybe this isn't considered a curry), garlic naan, and deep fried spinach appetizer. The head chef comes from one of the Michael Mina restaurants and his unique and special creations are amazing. My friends and I clearly go there too often bc he'll try out all his new dishes on us. Which is always good. 

Food - 6
Decor - 4
Service - 6

Easily 5 stars!
author: Jennifer L.

description:
(3.5)

I was craving chicken tikka masala from watching mukbangs and that also made me want to try butter chicken so I found Keeva on Yelp. 

I walked inside to pick up my order and the place wasn't too big nor too small. 

Chicken tikka masala (medium)- it was average the sauce was thicker than what I usually get and somewhat sweeter.. Medium was just right right amount of spicy not too hot.. however I enjoy very spicy food. 

Butter chicken (mild)- since I've never had butter chicken before I thought it was good pretty sweet I personally believe it was better than the chicken tikka masala. 

The chicken in both meals tasted okay not as tender as I'd like. 

The naan bread was delicious though. I recommend just getting naan bread and no rice. 

Overall, I might come back and try some other things!
author: An L.

description:
Delicious food and best service makes it one of the best Indian restraunt in town.
The Butter Chicken I had was amazing.
author: Saurabh C.

description: SO GOOD! Ordered delivery, it said 30-40 min wait on a Thursday; got here in 25 or so! The paneer masala was really tasty, as was chicken masala and challa makheer. The samosas were a little too salty, but the insides were delish! They also gave us a ton of mint chutney... yum! Definitely bookmarking this for another time
author: Sarah C.

description: Takeout lunch special does NOT come with nan- although advertised on website. Lunch special is exceptionally small portion relative to price. Service mediocre. Most likely first and last time will order from Keeva. Chicken tikka masala is too sweet.
author: Antoinette S.

description: Amazing food! Definitely order "mild" spicy though if you aren't someone that can handle a lot of spice.
author: Mauly M.

description: A very sweet, friendly place, with a smart, simple and well designed menu and great food.
author: Lawrence C.

description: I'd never been a big fan of Indian food, nor craved it, until I ate here. The staff/owners are fun and inviting, and the food is amazing. I got medium spicy chicken vindaloo curry with rice. Had a good kick and was very filling. Just writing this made my mouth water! Can't wait to come back.
author: Joey A.

description:
I have been here twice, both experience are excellent! 
-Outstanding customer service: always feel warm and welcoming. All the staff are nice 
-Extremely delicious food : the naan, goat curry and biryani rice never disappoint me! 
I wish I could come here everyday~
author: Noktong H.

description:
This review is also a shoutout to one of the owners, the fabulous Rita, aka the Diva of Keeva!

Since it's opening a few months ago, the owner has been so warm and welcoming to every diner who walks through her doors. Her friendliness and genuine interest in getting to know her customers and neighborhood makes me want to return. Every. Weekend. 

Now onto the food... I typically eat Indian food once every few months and am a (basic) creature of habit. My go-to dishes are chicken tikka masala, samoas, and garlic naan. Don't get me wrong, I love Indian food but (sometimes) my body does not - so I usually have to play it safe. Keeva's extensive menu included different food items from different parts of India and the owner took her time to describe the food and what goes into preparation (they even have a Tandoori chef in the kitchen!). She made it safe and fun for me to branch out and try new dishes. We were all impressed by the presentation, and then floored by taste and flavor.

See you soon, Rita!
author: John L.

description:
Best Indian food in the area. I always get the Chicken Tikka Masala, garlic naan and vindaloo. 

I have gotten both to go and dine in many times. Never once have I been disappointed. The price point is right where its supposed to be and ambiance is great. Wait staff is extremely friendly and the owner is hilarious. 

I like this because its different from all the other restaurant in the area that serve just about the same food. Solid choice both if you want take out or a nice casual dinner out.
author: Michael P.

description: Amazing. Some of the best Indian food I've ever had. They definitely deserve their high near five star average!!
author: Olivia S.

description:
Firstly, there are tandoori kebabs and a variety of naan bread. You name it. Then there's an array of home-made desserts like rasmalai, gulab jamun and lassis.

But forget all of these for today, and head straight for eggplant salan with biryani made just the way nawabs of Lucknow would.

Trust me; it's worth heading to inner Richmond district for some scrumptious Indian food that you are unlikely to get elsewhere in San Francisco Bay Area.
author: Priyanka S.

description: My friends and I LOVE  this place. We found it last year while visiting SF and fell in love. We returned again on our trip this year and still love it just as much. Super cute little restaurant with yummy food. Plus the lady who works there (Nikki?) is sooooooo cute and super sweet. We live in Orange County and we honestly haven't found an Indian Food place that we like as much as the food here.
author: Kelly J.

description:
Super expensive for the Ambience and quality of food they are providing ..

Food is very average .. worse than shalimar pakwan or even naan n curry

Biryani is super spicy.. has no veggies such as paneer .. mushroom and many more 

Paneer masala had smallest 6 paneer cubes 

Never coming back again


WASTE OF MONEY FOR SUCH BELOW AVERGAW FOOD
author: Anirudh M.

description:
Very tasty and food cooked just right.
I will not BS you by telling you what is authentic ...
   even people in the same region varies in the way they cook ...
   you might say "majority done in ____ region" ...
   the food is very well made and taste good ...
   
Palak Chat
    Fried Chickpea batter friters
    Baby spinach
    Mint Sauce
    Not for the light eater

Chicken Tikka Marsala
    Nice moist grilled chicken
    Rich creamy tomato sauce w pleasant spices
    
Lamb Korma
    Deboned lamb
    Creamy cashew based gravy
    Yummy
author: S.K. Y.

description:
What an amazing find!!! The family was so hard working and kind which really made the atmosphere feel welcome. 
The food was super authentic:
To start we had samosas which the waitress suggested. They had the perfect amount of spice & savor & were really crispy. 
We also got chicken tikka masala, rice, garlic naan, and lamb vindaloo. One of the most flavorful meals I've had in a long time! Definitely deserves all 5 stars!
author: Dylan H.

description:
Very nice food and friendly staff. 
The food can get very spicy so make sure you can handle hot...
author: Ron S.

description: Fucking good. Samosas, chicken Tikka masala, naan. Flawless. Decent selection of alcohol too actually. I'd come back, give it a try.
author: Scott V.

description: I've eaten in Indian restaurants all over the world, including quite a bit of time in India, and this is first rate. We had the Palak Paneer and Chicken vindaloo, which were outstanding. They give copious portions, everything is super tasty, and the staff is as friendly as you could ever want. Next time we visit San Francisco, returning here will definitely be on our list. At many Indian restaurants, too many of the dishes all taste the same. They all tasted very different here.
author: Laurence D.

description:
I must say that I was pleasantly surprised with this place. Walked in with very little expectation and it did not disappoint me. 

It is located on clement street and the only Indian restaurant on that street. The owner is very friendly and has a great sense of humor. 

I will recommend their Malai Kofta, Yellow Daal and Biryani. The spice level is perfect for Indian food.
author: Shiven G.

description: Wonderful Indian food.  My favorite so far has been the Chicken fenugreek.  The curry had the perfect spice and flavor.  I wish I could eat here more often.
author: Karen L.

description: This is a small, cozy shop with a colorful, lively interior. I ordered the samosas and they tasted fresh, but were a little on the oily side. The chicken tikka masala was a good mix of spicy and savory, with large chunks of chicken that blend seamlessly with the surrounding sauce. The only drawback is that you have to order a side of rice with any curries you order; rice isn't included making your meal more pricey. The naan was very well done, a perfect in between of crunchy and doughy. I would recommend this for anyone in the area craving some good quality Indian food!
author: Smrithi M.

description: Family owned, very personable service.  Goat curry with tender meat falls off the bone, spices come through, enough sauce for another meal.  Garlic naan, thin and crispy.  Tandoori chicken was tender, took 15 minutes which came with two sauces, green sour/sweet/slightly spicy  and brown sauce that was sweet as well..  Saute okra was sweet with onions.  Dessert, not sure what it is called, white, ricey, crushed pistachio, very refreshing and not overly sweet.  Taj beer was light.
author: Helen L.

description: Stopped in spur of the moment for dinner and was very glad I did.  I absolutely loved the Palak Chat (chickpea batter fried with baby spinach and mint sauce):  I couldn't get enough of it!  The Chicken Fenugreek was very good and the Classic Goat Curry was good: the sauce of the goat curry was tasty, but the goat itself was a bit chewy, as goat can sometimes be.  The service was excellent.  Price for two with 3 glasses of wine, garlic nan & rice in addition to the above:  ~$80 including tip.
author: Sarah F.

description: Keeva is my friend and I's go-to spot when we are craving Indian food. The owners are very nice and the food is amazing. We always get the tikka masala with garlic naan. Their tikka masala is more on the tomato-y side than creamy (which I like), and the chicken is very moist. We've also tried the tandoori wings, vegetable pakora, and the vindaloo. They always serve us a small dessert that changes every time we come. The restaurant is fairly small so be prepared for a small wait but it is worth it.
author: Linz C.

description:
#200!

I can't believe it took me this long to write a review. Keeva is pretty much the greatest thing to happen to Clement St since we moved to the Inner Richmond. It's a truly family-run business (as in it's normal for Rita's daughter to be running around the restaurant on a weeknight) and Rita is so open and friendly it almost feels like you are a guest in her home. The entire staff is just wonderful to be around, and the whole environment just makes me happy.

That alone would be enough for me to frequent this place, but on top of that I think it might legitimately some of the best Indian food I've ever had. Each dish is so thoughtfully crafted and presented you really can't go wrong, but if you're looking for recommendations the tandoori chicken and the biryani + ANY of the curries are the foundation of a fantastic meal. The biryani is usually enough for like 4 people and it's the most exciting rice I've ever had.

I want Keeva to thrive and be there forever but I'm just dreading the day when I inevitably have to stand in line for 2 hours because everybody in SF found out about our favorite Indian place.
author: Daniel B.

description:
Yummy food. Nice atmosphere. Friendly staff. 

I really enjoyed this place. It is a shame I don't live closer so I could eat here more often.
author: Gem B.

description:
Indian cuisine can be hit and miss...to spicy (hot) or short of flavor. Our daughter found the other reviews and photos and we rolled the dice, arriving right before they opened at 5pm. 

Five of us were seated and asked the lovely woman who seated us to help us select items to share. The Kingfisher beer was refreshing on a warm, humid evening. 

The food arrived, and the beautifully presented dishes looked small in size, but don't worry it was only a mirage. We didn't finish our meal and we sent the leftovers home with our college kid. 

Chicken Curry Chettinad
Prawn Coconut Curry
Butter Chicken
Palak Paneer
Garlic Nan/Rice

Everything was delicious with a unique blend of spice. I sense the Curry Chicken Chettinad was the crowd favorite. 

Service was great, and the restaurant filled with happy guests!

We will be back!
author: Steve L.

description:
I love it! An Indian restaurant recently popped up in the Richmond district, which has hitherto been a Chinese, Vietnamese or Thai stronghold. It is for sure a welcome addition to the dining scene on Clement. For a change, try some biryani instead of fried rice! Keeva took over a Thai place without much fanfare. The décor was not overdone but tastefully designed to be simple, clean and adorned with some fine artworks on the walls. Against the right wall was a long wooden bench with attractive cushions that were wrapped in exotic Indian-colored fabric.

The menu listed a few "starters" (oh so British!). Pakora ($6) seemed the most popular. Traditionally, pakora were served as deep-fried snacks like fritters. They caught my attention although I'm not even a big fan of fried foods. Keeva's version using a chickpea batter gave the pakora a unique crispy and nutty coating.  I personally liked that. The deep-frying was done almost perfectly without much grease but some pieces were still a tad soft and soggy. A duo of dippables, a dark colored tamarind and greenish mint chutney, were an awesome complement. (4/5)

It is rare to come across Egg Curry in a restaurant's menu. Perhaps it is now regarded as home style cooking. Nevertheless, it ranks high on my list of comfort foods. It is my favorite when I don't wish to have any chicken, meat or fish. I was told that Keeva's version is North Indian and I'll bet there are as many regional differences as there are egg sauces. Keeva is not about to disclose their recipes except to mention that the sauce is housemade with fresh tomatoes and onions. You can see why! The curry sauce was delicious and the heat level can be adjusted in accordance to your personal preference. The negative? Only 2 hard-boiled eggs lightly fried to form a delectable crust but at a steep price tag of $13.50! How much is the price of an egg nowadays? But the fact remained it was good....in fact damn good! (4/5) Cute name too "Bang Bang Egg Curry".

Chicken Tandoori (half $12.50; whole $24) in Keeva is a notch better than most. There was a fragrant crispy crust on the surface and blackened char on the edges and bones; the meat was moist, luscious and savory.  I would have preferred the chicken to be served on a hot sizzling plate with the chicken nestled on a bed of yellow onions and bell peppers. This way, the chicken would be kept warm while the tantalizing aroma filled the dining room. (4/5)

I always have this preconceived notion that Indian food is rice and curry. In my mind, a perfect ending to an Indian meal would always be Lamb Vindaloo ($14.50), which is my favorite. The curry had a hint of sourness from the nuanced vinegary marinade. This is the Goan style that Keeva was attempting to replicate. A potpourri of Indian spices contributed to the complex and robust flavors. It was tongue tingling perfect, and scrumptiously memorable served at my desired level of heat.  The potatoes were firm and crunchy to the bite and the lamb was "melt-in-your-mouth" tender. (4/5)

Unfortunately being located in a nondescript strip mall on Clement among the Chinese and Vietnamese cheap eats, the prices in Keeva do appear relatively pricey. We are of course comparing apples with oranges but there are people out there who don't care two hoots! Kudos to David G for his spot on review and I'm glad I tried all the dishes he recommended.
author: Geoff G.

description:
Stopped for lunch. They off a set menu at lunch time with 2 options, Vegetarian or Meat. Having had the meat option previously, I opted for vegetarian. The plate arrived with way too much food. Chana Masala,a little dry for my liking, Aloo Ghobi, also quite dry, and paneer matta. If this isn't enough already, wait, there's more. Salad, popadom, steamed Rice, and a basket of freshly baked Naan Bread! 
So, in short, too much , too dry! Wish the option was something simple like Tadka dal, and would it kill them to bake the rice, Pulao style?!!
author: rick b.

description:
I was super happy when this place opened in my neighborhood. 
The staff are a lovely family, always friendly, and give great service. 
I recommend the okra and tomatoes. It's addictive. The mango lassi is REALLY REALLY GOOD. 
Another bonus to this place is that it's halal,  which is great for my family, and not something you often find in SF restaurants.
author: Amina A.

description:
3.5 Dosas

I  am always excited when a new restaurant opens in the Richmond: Especially a non Cantonese one.

Keeva hits on some spots and misses on others:

Great little dinning spot with colorful art. Nice service albeit slow...they were slammed on a Saturday night. 

Presentation of food is excellent. The Tandoori came with a nice little salad. Bowls of things had a nice flair of spices swirled on top. It was a nice touch

Food is  a mixed bag. 

Tandoori Chicken: Some of the best I have had. Succulent, flavorful, and bursting with spices. Wonderful skin.  I wish I had ordered a full chicken. This was hands down the best dish. They actually have one chef who does nothing but Tandoori cooking

Pakoras were different than I have had before. I would say they were an indian tempura version of fried vegetables....using a chickpea batter. None the less they were light, crispy, and not oily. The accompanying two sauces were excellent. 

The lamb vindaloo was also excellent. Not too spicy, ample lamb and potatoes, great sauce. This is an excellent version and would order again.

Misses:

The Paneer Tikka masala was a funky sauce that had me thinking spaghetti sauce. Maybe some nether region of Indian...I don't know. Wasn't my favorite.

Naan was very mediocre: Greasy and brittle. Should have been light and fluffy.

Prices are not cheap as the three main dishes were in the 13-15 dollar range.

Since it is not far from me I would definetly come back and try other dishes
author: David G.

description: Love this place! Amazing authentic Indian food and awesome service. My fiancé's favorite place, we crave it time to time and we both agree, we don't want to go anywhere else for Indian food - Lamb Vandaloo is my favorite, make it extra spicy please!
author: Amanda E.

description: I was hoping to give this place 5 stars. The food tastes good and everything was well prepared.  But my chicken tikka masala was cold.  When you fail at delivering hot food you get stuck with 3 stars.
author: Matt D.

description:
Tried Palak Chaat, Bhindi, Chana Masala, and the curry with the peanut sauce (forgot the name).

All three were amazing....... my mouth is watering just thinking about it.

You could tell they put a lot of care into the food. Everything tasted fresh, high quality, and i liked that they put care into presentation (when many indian restaurants dont)

I dont think you can go wrong here so try anything that tickles your fancy
author: Ji K.

description:
The palaak paneer is the best thing on the menu. Much better than Trader Joe's!

Also, the owner (Rita) is as radiant as Priyanka Chopra
author: Phillip T.

description: The food was delicious and the servers were very welcoming and kind throughout the meal. It's a fun area of town to visit, glad I came!
author: Ivy C.

description: I believe they don't know how to make biryani. The way they made the biryani just mix rice with chicken and some vegetables mixed in.
author: Peram P.

description:
The foods were great, but they cheated on the bill - they added 15% tip to the total amount without telling us then came back to ask for more tips. When questioned, they said that they made a mistake to bring me the other table's bill - which was not true. They then simply said the wrong bill was voided, and asked us to go back to get the money if we are charged twice. 

This really put some shadow on our good mood after a nice walk and a nice meal. We don't think we will be going back to this restaurant again.
author: Lan L.

description:
Came here with a large group for a birthday dinner.  Staff were super friendly. Food was very flavorful at reasonable prices. Will definitely be back.

We had the palak chaat (best I have had in the bay), hara bhara kebeb, malai tikka kebab (juicy and succulent), dal makhni,  bang bang egg curry (must have), butter chicken and kadai panner.
author: Arvind M.

description:
My level of satisfaction has dropped  off, from previous visits and reviews.
This could be a change in the kitchen, or it could simply be, that I picked poorly from the menu.
That being said, the vindaloo is not spicy hot. The meat dishes in my opinion don't have enough meat. Case in fact, a prawn vindaloo should  have more than 4 prawns, even if their first name is all tiger. Their was a nice amount of potatoes in the curry. The
wine is still a good deal at $6. The rice  is ok, but the nann was disappointing.
My wife enjoyed her cauliflower and potatoe dish, the rice, and the naan.
Maybe I expect too much for $60, and should have had more wine.
author: Iain A.

description:
Overall: I'm between a 3 and a 4.  I'd give it a second chance though and try it again.  I ordered close to closing time so wonder if dining in or at another time would be different.

Delivery time: Record setting and the best I've ever experienced in SF.

Food: Hits and misses. Some of the curry dishes were just a lot sweeter than I expected.  The palak paneer was great and had less cream than other places.  The chicken tikka masala and some of the other dishes got sweeter and sweeter the closer we got to the bottom of the container.  The meat and vegetable texture was great, but the sweetness was really overpowering after a while.  Generous with the rice portions but not as much with the naan.
author: Kara M.

description:
What a GREAT find! Delicious flavorful food , kind and personable staff ,and reasonably priced!! Is this heaven?? 
We had 
An amazing appetizer that I cannot remember the name of but it was chickpea batter over spinach with mint sauce , it was INCREDIBLE ! 
Samosas ( perfectly seasoned with yummy chutney on the side )
Tikka Masala Medium spicy ( so flavorful and spicy, will make you sweat in the best way!)  
Garlic Naan ( amazing of course ) 

Thanks again Keeva! We will be back soon!
author: Evan P.

description: Amazing food. I especially love the paneer tikka masala. The waiting was a bit long but worth it- we went there for dinner on a weekend. Highly recommend.
author: Namrata J.

description: This is my new favorite Indian restaurant. The saag was not fully puréed, which was refreshing, and the chicken was fresh and cooked well. Also, the food was nicely spiced.
author: Morris R.

description:
Hands down, the best Indian restaurant I've been to since I discovered a love of indian food. You could close your eyes and point at 5 dishes and they would all be equally mind-blowingly good. They let you choose the level of spice (mild, medium, spicy, extra) and let me tell you the extra is EXTRA. I'm not weak when it comes to spices but this sh** is fire! Food here is equally good served there or brought home and reheated the next day.

Family-owned vibe, my friends and I come here at least once a week since we discovered this gem and they always remember us. Rita is a sweet heart -- she carries her baby around the floor and greets every one of her customers, cracks a light joke, moves on. Love coming here, would take a lot for us to stop.

Couple dishes that have stuck in my mind:
- Chicken tikka masala -- fan fav, a must try
- Butter chicken -- never had anywhere else but I order it every time here!
- Lamb vindaloo -- not overly lamby in taste, made to perfection
author: Nat E.

description:
LOVEEEE LOVE LOVE this place. The best indian resturant in the city hands down! My sister brother and I are regulars here, and we come about once a month sometimes even more;) I highly recommend the chicken tikka masala(fave dish), Garlic naan, tandoori chicken wings and I'm not sure what's the name of this last recommendation; but a must get is the fried spinach appetizer..thank me later hehe.

The wait staff is incredibly attentive and welcoming, I always have a great experience here! Rita the owner, is a boss chick and is always making sure you leave full and happy. She even makes it a point to check in with every table. Love this place and I will be back soon!
author: Susan L.

description:
The best Indian food i had in the city, the owner was there and it felt like we had her family  recipe,
Chicken wings were my favorite but the Lamb anything is the best meal to choose
author: Tony V.

description: Delicious!!! Every bit of meat was tender and juicy! The sauces were flavorful and tasted so fresh! Relaxed atmosphere surrounded by people enjoying their meals. Service was warm and friendly! Mango smoothies are a must!!! Great value for a family vacation- we love a well priced, delicious meal!!
author: Mary H.

description:
THE BEST INDIAN FOOD SINCE I LEFT ENGLAND, A QUARTER CENTURY AGO!

For an Englishman such as myself, the last happy vestige of the British Empire is the enormous number of superb Indian and Pakistani restaurants in the UK.  

Forced to flee Thatcher's annihilation of the Oxbridge system (from which "She Who Must be Obeyed" benefited so richly herself), I followed the old adage, "Go West, young man!"  And I have been thrilled to live here in the Bay Area ever since.  BUT, I continue to miss my pubs terribly, and I miss my local Oxford Indian restaurants even more!

After kissing Aleph-Naught frogs, Yelp finally led me to Keeva Indian Kitchen just four short weeks ago.  The quest for the Holy Grail [pardon the mixed metaphors] was finally at an end!

I have only eaten here a few times, thus far, though always with large groups, allowing for the sampling of many yummy things.  The dishes have varied from the "Merely Excellent" to the "Magical".  Here are my suggestions to date, though much of the menu remains tantalizingly unexplored...

MERELY EXCELLENT

Palak Paneer
Dal Makhani 
Chicken Tikka Masala 
Tandoori Chicken:  Yelp reviewers RAVE about this dish, and it is indeed EXCELLENT.  However, I believe the version at India Palace in Mill Valley may actually beat this one out.  But read on...

SUPERB

Tandoori Wings: Very unusual, in my experience, and with more pronounced flavour than the straight Tandoori chicken above.
Chicken Curry Chettinad
Chicken Fenugreek 
Prawn Vindaloo
Lamb Korma [but as superb as it is, India Palace takes this one, too.]
Bhindi do Piazza
Crusted Cumin Potatoes
Indian Eggplant in Salan Sauce
ALL the nan breads: crispy on the outside, and chewy on the inside, like the best Italian thin pizzas!

MAGICAL

Palak Chat
Classic Goat Curry [I suggest getting this one FULL spicy.]
Lamb Roganjosh

While I have devoted this entire review to the wonderful food, let me end by pointing out that the ambience, and especially the SERVICE (by Nikki and Rita) make this restaurant wonderfully inviting and super-friendly.  

Please trust me: This place will knock you for SIX!
[Yank translation: it's a home run!  ;-]
author: Tristan N.

description: This place got great reviews, but I can only imagine they must be from people that have not really enjoyed Indian food from a great restaurant. I ordered a very standard dish, Paleek Paner, and while it wasn't terrible it wasn't great. This place could really benefit from some more seasoning and offering spice levels. I'm not used to Indian food being bland, but this really was. Definitely wish I had tried one of the other highly recommended places.
author: Leah S.

description:
So yummy! 

I live near the tenderloin Indian part and traveled to outer Richmond to give this place a try and oh boy! I am glad I did!

Had okra, eggplant sauce, naan and the tandoori chicken. Was so good! My date is UK born Indian man who enjoyed the meal as much as I did. 

I wish this place all the success and happy to see that good restaurants now spreading all over the city!
author: Anelya S.

description: First time here and it was delightful.  Family run restaurant and very friendly.  Ordered the tika masala, okra and one of the paneer dishes - all mild (because we had a child with us) Generous portions  and mild is actually mild here so that was good.  Each dish was full of flavor - not too salty- and tasty.  We'll be back for more -for sure!
author: Marcia K.

description: WE had lunch here last week and enjoyed the food and the service.  We had goat curry which was a bit spicy for us, we'll ask for less pungent next time.  Going back friday so it must be good.
author: Kent P.

description: Amazing food, fantastic presentation, quick service, superb decorations with a melodious environment. Don't forget to order the Palak Chaat!!
author: Ankit D.

description:
I believe this Indian restaurant took over what used to be Thai restaurant, which we were supposed to go. Instead, we landed here. We tried Chicken Tikka Masala, it was a bit spicy for younger son, but the spicy and smoky flavor hit the spot for me. My oldest ordered the Classic Lamb curry and naan. Curry was perfect for him. It was tasty and lamb was super tender. Worked great with the naan. I got the Indian eggplant. It was a unique and and distinctive taste, just wished they weren't so stingy on the eggplant. Luckily I wasn't that hungry that day.

A bit pricey for the portion size, but the food is pretty solid. Will come again to try other dishes.
author: Em T.

description:
Decent place for Indian food. Place is small but the food was good. We started with Chicken Kebab which was amazing. Kebabs were well spiced, salted and cooked (Not overdone or burnt or undercooked), just the right amount. Then came the Chicken Tikka Masala which was creamy and delicious. Unlike most places it was not overly sweet. I hate it when people make Chicken Tikka Masala sweet. But this was really good. Chicken biryani was decent, a little different from what I have had but not bad. 
Even the veg options of Chana Masala and Kadai paneer was good.
author: Animesh K.

description:
Just, wow.

I will say, first of all, that I have gotten to-go from here five or six times so far and it has been consistent every single time. The flavors have so much depth and balance, the meat is cooked perfectly, it's spicy both in terms of piquancy and aromatics, even the WINE is on point.

--

What to order:

-Literally anything (everything we've gotten has been spot on)

-Chicken Tikka Masala - there's so much depth of flavor happening here and the chicken is perfectly cooked to be melt-in-your-mouth tender but still have the smokiness of the tandoor. The only other place I've ever had chicken tikka masala this on point was at Tamarind in London which literally is Michelin starred and costs $30 USD for the same portion.

-Goat Curry - wow, just wow.  There's all the love that you'd expect from Indian home-cooking, but then it's buttoned up to be a class act with julienned ginger and these perfectly balanced spices and textures.

-Palak Paneer - super garlicky (in the best way) and just, refreshing and emotionally uplifting.

--

Anyways, I would recommend Keeva to:

1. an Indian person straight from India
2. any snobby SF foodie
3. any not-snobby SF foodie
4. people who love spicy (they will crank it up for you)
5. people who don't love spicy (they will crank it down for you)
6. vegetarians
7. meat lovers

...so basically the entire population.

I will end by noting that I'm normally the type to only write negative reviews on Yelp because I'm a kind of an ass of a critic and even for my favorite places I hesitate to review out of fear that they will become popular and "taken" from me. Well, Yelpers, this is my holiday gift to you-thank me later.
author: Ryan J.

description: A nice little restaurant with good food. Fresh ingredients. A little more expensive than most Indian restaurants but I think the food quality is better. We had the fish appetizer, goat biriani and the eggplant dish. Good biriani but not much goat and mostly bones. (Be careful of the bones, they aren't obvious). Next time I'll stick to lamb or chicken.
author: Priscilla C.

description: Food. Literally the best tandoori chicken I've had in the west coast. Their curry portions are great and all their ingredients are really fresh. Other props to hara bhara kebab, veg korma and all of their naans. Their food keeps you and your tummy happy well through and after your dinner which typically is not the case with other Indian restaurants. If you crave for good Indian food (authentic) this is the real deal.  I'll definitely come back.
author: Rajiv R.

description:
Keeva is hands down the best Indian food in the city. All of the dishes are served fresh and everything I've had here is delicious. Favorites are:

- Lamb Vindaloo
- Chicken Tikka Masala
- Palak Paneer
- Dal Makhani 
- Chicken Tikkas

Also the owners (hey Rita!) and staff are great and only enhance the already great dining experience. Highly recommend. 

Also - obligatory "I'm Indian so I know good Indian food"
author: Ravi R.

description: LOVE Keeva for its delicious food and the most friendly staff. My son has a bunch of food allergies and the staff is very easy to work with around allergies. I also love their chai.
author: Grace B.

description: Ummmm, wow! So good. I ordered delivery (thru UberEATS) last night, and after my first bite of samosa, I already knew this is my new go-to for Indian. SO GOOD. Very flavorful. I also ordered the tikka masala, this was excellent as well. I made the error of ordering medium spicy. I definitely should've chosen mild (medium was just a little too much burn for me - I guess I got a little ambitious), but that's my fault. If it had been mild, I highly doubt there would've been leftovers! Garlic naan was super tasty, too. I look forward to ordering from here again soon!
author: Cheryl S.

description: Service is great here as is the food. There are many vegetarian options. I had garlic naan and aloo ghobi. Both were flavorful and excellent. They offer a lunch special which has a generous amount of food. I noticed fellow diners new to Indian food; the lunch special is a good introduction. Decor is lovely. Keeva is a great addition to the neighborhood.
author: Carol W.

description:
This place rocks! We discovered it tonight although it's been around for about a year.
The food was some of the best Indian food that I've had (and I have traveled to India) and the service was excellent.
Great vegetarian and vegan options as well. 
I will definitely be back :)
author: Andrew A.

description: Delicious food and the nicest staff! It's not easy to find a restaurant that not only tolerates, but welcomes, children and Keeva definitely does just that. The owner is always so sweet with our son when we dine in. You can really taste that the food is made with love, so don't expect it to be a quick turn around from ordering to eating. It's not the cheapest, fastest Indian restaurant around, but it is definitely the most delicious.
author: Veronica F.

description: I really wanted to eat at Shabu Club but the wait was too long so we ended up trying Keeva for dinner instead since it's across the street. I'm so glad that we did that because this was the best Indian food I've ever had. We ordered the wings, tikka masala, goat curry, and garlic naan. Everything was so flavorful and well seasoned compared other Indian restaurants we have been to. The tikka masala and curry was thick and paired well with the naan. The service was attentive and quick. We finished everything and enjoyed the meal so much that I already asked other friends to come try Keeva with me.
author: Jenn W.

description:
Ordered delivery but called ahead because I wanted something not on the menu: spinach and chickpeas. The woman who took my call said no problem - just order palak paneer and write "no cheese, add chickpeas instead". I did.  What I got was simply palak paneer - it had cheese and no chickpeas. To make matters worse, it was absolutely cold.

Also ordered- chicken tikka masala which was hot and delicious, very tender and flavorful. Not so for the lamb vindaloo which was dry and tasteless.

I was surprised by the raita which had an odd flavor that I didn't like. And while the naan has good consistency, I got garlic which I didn't order and don't care for.
author: R. P.

description:
My new favorite Indian food in SF. I have been looking for a while. I used to love that place on Haight and Fillmore years ago before it changed owners.

We had no place to go for Xmas eve and all the usual suspects were already fully booked.

I searched Yelp for Highest rated indian food in SF, and this place popped up with about 87 reviews and 4.5 stars. I had never seen it before, and it looks like it has only been open about 2-3 months. I called to see if they were busy of if there was a line - "nope" they said.

We go there around 6:30, only one other table occupied. I had perused the photos and menu from the Yelp photos and had made my choices. Many reviews said they got free pakoras (They said they were no longer doing that but brought us some anyway) They were good enough that I would happily order them again. Kinda like onion rings but made with cauliflower, zucchini, some onions and other veggies.

I told the owner about an indian restaurant I loved in the south bay: https://www.yelp.com/biz/satkar-indian-cuisine-sunnyvale
he said he had been there too - that he is always checking out other indian food restaurants to get ideas. He is a good guy and is really invested in his businesses success, this place is definitely a labor of love for him.

We ordered the samosas, the chicken tikka masala & the eggplant in peanut sauce, one onion nan and one garlic nan. He brought out our orders - PLUS a generous sample of a dal and an okra dish...both were also really good.  There were photos of a rack of lamb on Yelp - that he says some doctors from UCSF had been begging for, he hopes to put it in the menu permanently at some point, let me know I wanna try it!!!

We bought a bottle of wine we could not finish - but he had saved the screw top so we took home a lot of leftovers.

This is the kinda place you want to be a regular at - and after one visit - I feel like I already am, they were so generous. I would put money on the guy remembering us - even if it takes us a few months to get back there!

I sent my man out for pastries from anywhere on Xmas morning - he came back empty handed saying "everything was closed", so we had leftover Indian food, might have been even better the next day and quite a festive Christmas breakfast!
author: Amy W.

description: Great Indian food adapted for American taste. Food is not too spicy(unless you ask for it), good service!
author: Tanvi P.

description: On a trip to San Francisco for literally one day I was craving Indian food.  We searched the nearest spot and ended up here.  It was hands down the best Indian food I've ever had and definitely top 5 best meals I've had.  Service was fast but personable.  Will be back every time I'm in the city.
author: Robin P.

description: Every dish was delicious. Crispy spinach, naan, paneer, and tikka masala were especially good. Rita was so kind and accommodating of our group. I will come back again soon!
author: Sam M.

description: This is the BEST Indian food in San Francisco. No joke. Rita and Ajeet know what's up. The flavors are incredible and everything is made in small batches. Such good food!!! The eggplant dish is unreal and Rita's palak chat is an addiction. Love supporting a local family and their delicious food! Could eat here everyday if I could afford it!
author: maria k.

description: Our favorite Indian restaurant, hands down, in town! The saag paneer is our favorite.
author: Frieda B.

description:
I just ordered food from Keeva today through Postmates for my Indian boss.  He said the food was really good and we should order from there again.  Today we ordered the Lamb Roganjosh.  Will try one of their chicken dishes next time.  

The naan came over super hot and fluffy, even though we're close to AT&T park and it took 20 minutes for our Postmates to get to us.  

I don't give out 5 stars easily, but my boss felt like they deserved 5 stars.  I'm on a diet or I would have tried and reviewed myself.  =)
author: Vi Y.

description:
My cousin told me about this place.  One of her friends did the artwork, and she recommended I go here and try the cumin roasted potatoes.

And I highly recommend them too! They are absolutely delicious.  I don't even need rice.  They compliment the other dishes well.  Among the three times I've been here, I got the Bang Bang egg curry, the grilled shrimp, and chana masala.

The egg curry is delicious! The two eggs are hard boiled in a flavorful, slightly sweet, curry sauce.  The grilled shrimp comes with a tiny salad, and are about medium in size.  The chana masala is more savory, and darker in color, than the other ones I've had in the past.

It's a little on the pricey side.  The average entree is around $13.95, including the egg curry.  But the food is very delicious. I also recommend getting the mango lassi.

I also really like the atmosphere.  It's beautifully decorated and the staff really make you feel welcome and at home.  I'm so happy for this new addition to the Inner Richmond, and I plan on bringing more of my friends and family here in the future.
author: Vira P.

description:
This place is wonderful! They are so friendly, the food is excellent - much better than most Indian restaurants in SF (but beware very spicy). This is the best addition to the neighborhood, I will definitely be a regular!

The amritsari fish and veg kebabs are simply perfect!
author: Maya M.

description: My favorite Indian restaurant. The owner of the restaurant is so lovely and the food is fabulous.
author: Tanya J.

description: This place feels authentic, while still being very clean and friendly. The servers always remember you and the food is great. This place is a regular stop for dinner on the way home after a long day.
author: Frank T.

description:
TLDR: best Indian food in SF, go here, your night and your life will be happier for it! 

Full story: Rita used to run Saffron Grill in Alamo Sq. where we lived for 6 years (and we were almost weekly customers) - they sold the business and my wife and I were super bummed. 

A few months later we moved to the Richmond dist. and at a friend's suggestion tried Keeva - we walk in and much to or surprise...it's Rita!! As others have mentioned, she is the most gracious, fantastic owner who makes it feel like you are dining at your friend's restaurant every time. 

The food at Keeva is spectacular, even better than during Rita's days at Saffron - I am a bit snobby when it comes to North Indian food, and find many of the places in SF disappointing - Keeva is fantastic, from the chaats to the curries to tandoori, there is subtlety with depth of flavor, attention to detail, diversity in the menu, new takes on classics (the tikka masala will blow your mind) and not greasy at all. Rita + her husband and the amazing chefs/staff at Keeva are just killing it!
author: Ben B.

description:
keev Keeva! who drink lassis for ma deena!
hangry am iiiiiii de curries dem sugar
how can iiiiiii eat love to entreea in a rush
pass me de deesh to 4top

TL;D-EEZY-BEEZYS tasty food dragged down by inconsistent portions. 40ish mins avg till seated* + 30-40ish mins till food** friday nite. $50+ pp but wasn't full. ok start, can improve.

at the end, the receipt showed they'd misheard my appetizer order as an entree. but i was *glad* bc my other entree had so little meat #twss that i needed the quantity boost.

what's ironic is i figured i'd take some okra home. but after the lightly portioned curries, you'd better believe i wolfed down the whole bowl of okra. go figure this was the best portioned dish.

they're still new. if / when they iron out the food : liquid ratios in the curries i may round up to the 4 stars i initially thought to give.

(^_^) Mango lassi $4 (http://bit.ly/2eRAmNe)
drinkyo froyo
sip slowww till your food comes

(^_^) Garlic nan $3 (http://bit.ly/2f1Klfw)
need it w curry dishes

(-_^) Crispy okra $12 (http://bit.ly/2ekXCjo)
indian flavor twist on a classic dish

(-_^) Mattar paneer $13 (http://bit.ly/2dQw60T)
arrived instead of Paneer Pakora app
mostly peas few cheese

(v_v) Butter chicken $14 (http://bit.ly/2dWAV3X)
2 different servers asked if i wanted it boxed. it appeared untouched - that's how much liquid was left after i ate the approx 6 chicken bits
their reaction made me think this bowl was a fluke
tender n tasty tho

SEATING one window 5/6top & 9 4tops. that's it. majority of parties when i went were 2 people = lots of awkwardly half-filled tables with an extended waitlist. yes it's a small space #twhs but hopefully they'll switch out some 4tops for 2tops to streamline for a clearly large part of their customership.

SERVICE friendly. waitresses may have had slight language barriers; no big deal. main boss woman was very cheerful.

AMBIENCE loved the local artist paintings (daly city holla). loved the imported golden hefty utensils.

best wishes!

*yes i observed the parties waiting outside
**as well as the parties waiting inside
author: Dan B.

description: Food is really excellent in this small family restaurant. Can get kind of busy during peak times.
author: Descartes L.

description: The food here is so rich and flavorful! They have several vegetarian options, but those dishes lack a little robustness in ingredients.
author: Jenn F.

description: The food here is amazing, home-cooked Indian food with a kick! Chill ambiance, the dal is delicious. Good, solid. Best Indian restaurant in town!
author: Chinh P.

description: This place knocks it out of the ballpark every time. Amazingly delicious with strong flavors and just the right amount of spice (I get medium). The staff is always smiling and the place has a home-like feel to it.
author: Fleur R.

description:
The best restaurant in San Francisco by far!!! 
Great authentic Indian food. We enjoyed it every bite!!
author: Oz L.

description:
Lesbihonest. It's difficult to find a decent Indian restaurant in the city without having to pay a small fortune for the meal. Think Dosa or Amber, which are good, but even those are not as good as Keeva. 

First of all, I'm so happy that this place opened up in the neighborhood. Since my initial visit to Keeva, I have been having cravings for Indian food like no other and am glad that this is only a skip and a hop away from my apartment. 

I've been so used to sticking with the usual...chicken tikka masala, butter chicken, lamb curry, garlic naan, and those are all so good here. What I enjoy even more are the many other dishes on the menu that the owner suggests, er...well strongly suggests, to expand my horizon (like chicken fenugreek, chettinad goat curry, and more I can't even remember). Since then I've been learning so much more about Indian flavors and spices, and it's a party in my mouth ever since! (Get your mind out of the gutter.)

In summary: Neighborhood spot, fair price point, great selection, delicious food, amazing service, and A+ presentation! I'm a believer (and a regular). Five stars all the way!
author: Jeremy F.

description: Stay Away. Ordered through Caviar. Worst butter chicken ever seen. It was sour and watery. Absolutely no gravy or sauce, but sour tomato flavoured water.
author: Shan T.

description: What an incredible experience! Our family of 8 with various dietary restrictions, was able to eat here no problem. The cuisine is ayurvedic inspired. A true find in a city with so many options. Its family owned and we felt like we were part of their family when we were there. Thanks for all the recommendations and the great feeling of eating concious and balanced. We will definitely be back!
author: Brit K.

description: I have dined here about 3 times for dinner.  There is generally a short wait cuz we always dropped in and did not make reservations. The owner seems to remember all her customers, including us, and is very social and friendly.  We always order the bang bang egg, a curry dish, momos, several types of naan, tikka masala and tandoori chicken. The food and service is always excellent.  I will definitely recommend this restaurant to my friends and co-workers.
author: VC D.

description: The curry was not watered down at all. Perfect consistency. The tikki masala isn't spicy (I ordered a medium spicy) but has a bit of sweetness which separated it from other restaurants. The chicken chettinaudwas quite spicy however and these two are great to have together. Naan was great. The service was fantastic. Great spot for your standard Indian cravings.
author: Sor C.

description:
Great new restaurant on clement! The staff was very welcoming and made awesome recommendations for some of their top dishes. We ordered the channa masala and paneer makhani which were excellent. At the end they brought out a complimentary mango pa with saffron which was soo yummy!! 
Thanks Rita for the hospitality!! - Kel and Mel
author: Kelly M.

description: Closest thing to home cooked Indian that exists in SF! Everything is incredible especially the palak Chaat, the eggplant, and rasmali. Rita makes everyone feel at home from the minute you walk in the door.
author: Rahul M.

description:
I absolutely LOVE Indian food and have tried most places in the city, usually only to be disappointed. Thank you for opening up in the Inner Richmond. We need more good places like this!

I went here a few months ago when this place had first opened and had a great experience. The owner husband and wife were warm and welcoming and the service was seamless. They gave us a free appetizer to start. We ordered the Lamb Vindaloo and Paneer Tikka Masala (not on the menu -- subbed paneer for chicken) and garlic naan. They didn't bat an eyeless and the substitution about the came out quickly and was incredibly flavorful. 

No real negatives here other than portions weren't as large as other places I've been for the $$...or maybe I'm just bitter and ate too much to have a substantial amount of leftovers.
author: Christine M.

description: My favorite Indian food I have tried so far!! The atmosphere is cozy and the service is wonderful!
author: Lily S.

description: Absolutely delicious, healthy Indian food!  The restaurant is charming and inviting.  It's also great to have it delivered.
author: Anne B.

description: Wow. This place is the real deal. I love Indian food and this place did not disappoint. Very friendly service, utterly amazing food, and very reasonable prices for the Bay area. This is not a place to be missed if you like good Indian food.
author: Jay B.

description: This is one of the best Indian restaurants I've been to. They provide a wealth of new and different dishes that they are willing to test on new customers. Every recommendation was amazing! Highly recommend: spinach salad, chicken tandoori, onion naan, and butter chicken. Dishes to try that are not on the menu are spinach salad and Indian fried chicken.
author: Christina M.

description: Super yum! Nice ambience, super laid back. Excellent food. Everything is ala carte so could be pricy if you don't pay attention to how much you order but well worth the price!
author: Jon'el H.

description: Ordered three recommended dishes and they were all amazing! Heat level definitely varied by dish but i couldn't stop eating till i was stuffed regardless. Not the biggest portions but they're still filling! The service was icing on the well-spiced curry cake.
author: Leslie D.

description:
Good family environment, great vibes, amazing food! Was misgendered but I ain't even worried about it lol
luv u
author: Jack A.

description: Easily one of the best, most reasonably priced, and consistently excellent Indian restaurants in SF. The palak chat is a must have, but it is hard to pick because everything we've ever ordered has been delicious. The spice level is high and we regretted going for the 'medium' on one of our visits. Go for the 'low' if you're a wimp like me.
author: S G.

description: Best Indian food in the Richmond. Such friendly staff. Always laughing, going out of their way to make sure you are happy. Can be a bit of a wait as it is a popular spot but worth it. Everything is good but really enjoyed the lamb last night.
author: Jay D.

description: Got the non vegetarian lunch box set, with a side of naan, to go. Good portion of food and worth the price. Food was nice and flavorful, only thing is that the salad is pretty much an afterthought, I appreciate the gesture, but the salad was like a few leaves of lettuce on top of the rice. But overall good food.
author: Yeah O.

description:
Good food, great service! We ordered a soup, an appetizer, a chai and a paneer dish and rotis for the main course. The food was tasty. The rotis could have better. 

We had a 2 month old with us. The owner served us well and also offered to warm some water for us for his formula. 

We will come back. Finally found a place where we can go after a day trip to the city. The location is good as well.
author: Aman G.

description: I wish I could come here more often. All of the dishes taste so different from one another; you can have a completely different meal every visit. You will have a perfect meal no matter what you order -- even if it's 3 veggie dishes or 3 chicken dishes. They are all so different. Unique, tasty addition to the Inner Richmond! It's about $15 to $20 per person -- go for 1 entree per person and add rice or bread or both. If you are on a diet, try the appetizers...all of them...or omit the carbs. Owner knows everyone -- run for governor.
author: Ato Z.

description: Amazing Indian Food. The "medium" spicy will make you sweat, so even if you consider yourself someone who likes spicy food, I'd probably choose Mild for your first time. I usually go with samosas, garlic naan, chicken tikka. One of my absolute favorite restaurants in the Inner Richmond!
author: Martha P.

description: Have been looking hard for decent Indian food in SF. Haven't found it!  Palak paneer was bland. Aloo Matar tasted burnt. Where are the flavors and spices?!  This food was tasteless and totally underwhelming!  Will not be back.
author: Gee W.

description: Excellent food. Best I have had in the us. Had the Turks dal, kadhai paneer and eggplant salan. Will have to come back for more later
author: Sunita D.

description: Our team dined at Keeva for our quarterly team outing. The food amazed everyone, including Indians and non-Indians. Their Tandoori wings are so tender and so well marinated. Every bite is full of flavors. Goat biryani is to die for, and you can notice the delicacy in every element of this complex bowl of rice. It's definitely my #1 rated Indian restaurant, the chef delivered unforgettable favors in an arty presentation. We will go back to it for sure! Thumbs up!
author: Zifang H.

description:
When deciding to come here yesterday, I was thinking to myself - what's up with all the "hands down"

Shredy wrote a review that said, and I quote, "Hands down the best indian food" - and Janet wrote, again to quote, "Hands Down the best Tandoori place in the bay!" and so on. My work colleague said it was "hands down the best saag (Indian spinach dish)" he has ever eaten and traditional in style (not that creamy buttery mess that most places have). 

5 min drive from my place, easy parking on a rainy day in the city when people stay in --- all right, why not, let's try it.

My wife is raised in Delhi and her father is a tremendous cook. My Mom is an off the charts Indian cook. Our bar is pretty high. So I don't expect much either from Indian restaurants -usually I go to Indian places as "comfort food" - it's fatty but yummy, fills you up, you feel happy, you go home, you pass out. Given all the "hands down" I was hoping this place wasn't going to be that. So we ordered:

Starter:
Hara bara kebab
It's relatively rare to find this appetizer. It's simple sounding but hard to make well. This was the best I have had in many many years. WOW. Perfect texture. Perfect balance. Practically melted in my mouth upon first bite. Amazing. Now I had high hopes for the rest of the meal.

Dish 1:
Goat Curry Classic
My wife gew up eating goat and not lamb. She never orders goat at places since again, master chef Dad makes insanely good goat at home. We ordered it here. Fantastic. Flavorful. Spicy but not too spicy. Spot on.

Dish 2:
Tandoor chicken half
STAR OF THE SHOW
What in the freaking world? Are you kidding me? On Clement street? Did this just happen?
Presentation was lovely. Side chutney paired perfectly. Chicken was cooked absolutely perfectly, and that is the FIRST time in SF I can say that about tandoori chicken. Reminded me of the best of Delhi actually. I will likely order this every single time I come, it's just that good

Side smaller dish:
Aloo Matar
Simple dish, but again, it's all about authenticity and freshness and they do it well. 

Dessert
Ras Malai
Small light dessert, but the presentation was unique, I've never seen it like that. They had this foam on top of the ras malai itself (high end restaurant dessert style influence?). Creative!

PRICES:
I put this in caps since I think people have it all wrong. "It's a little expensive for Indian"  seems to be in some reviews. That's like saying Californios (Michelin Star, 4.5 Yelp review) is "expensive for Mexican food" -- dude, not all food from a culture is created equal!!! Nobody goes to Kokkari and says "this is expensive for Greek food" comparing it to your local lunch spot that serves gyros.  Yes, if this was cream heavy, butter heavy, not so fresh typical Indian takeout at $10 a dish, sure, it's a few bucks a dish bit more than that. But for the quality and presentation, it was worth every penny and I think actually their prices are beyond fair for the quality, vs some Indian places at $8 a person I find over priced for the quality. 
- tl:dr version --- you get what you pay for, and the quality to price ratio here is an A+

Overall, I walked out knowing we will be back, having had the best tandoori chicken I've had at a restaurant in decades (sorry, Amber, you're not even close), feeling like SF finally had an Indian restaurant that I look forward to and don't feel fat the next day after eating. You must try this place ASAP and my hope is that it's super successful so I can be coming here for a long time.
author: Sai S.

description:
Five stars for excellent customer service, great flavors and portion sizes, and reasonable prices. What a gem of a find in the Inner Richmond! 

I visited for lunch with co-workers and had one of the most well-balanced meals in terms of size and variety in quite some time. Even with the limited options ((1) a vegetarian combo or (2) a non-vegetarian combo), we were satisfied with what was offered and came away pretty full.

I recently ordered delivery and thought, certainly, this would be the test. Often restaurants are great when you dine-in but flub it up when it comes to delivery or takeout. That was not the case. My meal arrived on time and piping hot, and all of the items that could have potentially spilled (sauces,  mango lassi) were tightly wrapped up in saran wrap so as to prevent any messes. I ordered the chicken biryani, samosas, an extra side of biryani rice, tandoori naan, and mango lassi to split with my partner. Everything was delicious, well-seasoned, and the chicken in the biryani was SO MOIST (none of that bland white meat to be found!). We had enough for two meals and can't wait to go back for more.

Glad to have a nearby Indian option that's tasty, affordable, and not going to make you feel gross/greasy at the end of it.
author: Bianca P.
