description: This is now my favorite Indian place in the Bay Area. The prawn curry and chicken tikka masala were really good. Were already planning our next visit for next weekend. Can't wait to try the butter chicken and chicken biryani!
author: Akanksha M.

description:
all 3 people who ate from our last order got super sick. got the egg curry, chicken vindaloo, okra (tasty btw), daal, paneer (only 6 pieces!! of paneer)
disappointing and still recuperating....
author: CK K.

description: Had takeout once. Flavor and taste was great. Naan was delicious. But, wasn't impressed with the portions at all.
author: Daniella J.

description:
Hands Down the best Tandoori place in the bay!  The tandoori chicken here is as good as it gets! 

Got the half tandoori chicken ($12) and it was honestly the best tandoori I have ever had in SF. It wasn't dry (unlike most of the tandoori I've had), the spice rub was really good (super flavorful), and the char was on point. 10/10! 

I also got the bang bang egg curry and there was certainly a bang in that curry! Got it medium spicy and it had just the right amount of kick. However, the curry was a tad bit on the sweeter side, but it was still good! 

I mixed the egg yolk in the curry and it was heaven! 

The garlic naan was also on point. Crispy on the bottom with lots of garlic flavor!

P.S- The owner/worker of the place is just adorable! She was so nice and made the restaurant super welcoming! Great service!

I will definitely come back so I can try their tandoori fish/lamb!
author: Janet K.

description:
Atmosphere: authentic
Service: genuine 
Food: phenomenal 

My friend Tobias has been raving about this place ever since it opened and now I can see why. 

Everything from the presentation of each plate to the taste was top shelf. Additionally, the owner and chef came around regularly to check on my party of 6 to ensure everything was to our liking. 

Would definitely recommend ordering the butter chicken and lamb chops with any sides of your choosing--they're all great.
author: Matt M.

description: Just finished out third meal from Keeva this week; we keep craving it! My husband and I have really enjoyed everything we've eaten. The heat level is legit, so I'd recommend starting with mild and working your way up. For example, we had the Dal mild but even better kicked up to a medium. Love the Curry Prawns but enjoyed better at a mild level. We're pretty much working our way through all of the vegetation dishes and have not been disappointed. My husband loves the samosas and the Paneer dishes are solid. Stoked that it's so close to our house - neighborhood gem!
author: Noel A.

description:
Food was delicious. Customer service felt so honest and pure. Thoroughly enjoyed. 
Felt homey, was seated quickly, portions were perfect, if you are in the city it is a must to experience.
author: Julianna W.

description:
I have a North Indian tongue and my spice (not just chilli) palette is not easily pleased, but after a long hunt throughout the city, I finally feel home. 

Ambience : is cozy and welcoming

Menu: is sufficiently interesting, a little overwhelming, but I can't complain, since I want it all. 

Presentation: food on your plate looks just wonderful, the colours, the composition is well done

Flavour: the food leaves by far the most pleasing I've tried in the city. And oh have I tried the city!

Service: it's well timed, welcoming and occasional surprises (good ones)

You're in a good place, throw back and unwind!
author: Dipinti K.

description: This place is so good!  So flavorful and they are really friendly and help you pick out great choices!  These little fried potato balls were my everything!
author: Emily H.

description: Authentic Indian Food made from the best ingredients. We loved our time here, the chaat was really wonderfully done. The mountain goat curry - excellent. We will be coming back soon!
author: Koalie W.

description:
If you want to eat great indian food and not pay really high, this is the place to go.

Going there was a great decision. We went there for celebrating a friend's birthday yesterday and we could not be more happy. Everything they served us was so well prepared and tasted really good. 
Chicken Fenugreek, Chicken Malai Kababs, Chicken Biriyani was just amazing, the best that it ever can get. The nans were amazing - light and extremely soft and easy to eat. Everything was so well cooked and garnished that we just loved it.

Do order the tandoori chicken there, I bet you would not have had any better in SF

They also did some complementary Thandais which clears your palette at the end of the meal, and it was just amazing.
author: Sankha S P.

description:
I'd skip this place going forward. I was waiting for a to-go order with a clear view of the kitchen where I witnessed the cook eating a meal with his bare hands and then plating food with those same bare hands without washing them (including the order I picked up); it happened at least 10 times in the span of time I was there.

Also, the woman waiting on tables had her daughter following her around playing on an iPad.

The whole place just scream unprofessional and unsanitary.
author: Kaleen S.

description: Food quality was great but portion sizes for the price were pretty poor.  Our Tikka Missala literally had 5 pieces of chicken in it for $13.95.  Yikes!
author: Tammy M.

description:
The place is chill and very friendly,the food is excellent and the service is the best!
I recommend this restaurant in the inner Richmond district.
author: Mitch L.

description:
I don't eat Indian food that much but this place makes me want to eat more of it.  I've been here twice with my friends and this place has not failed me.  I can honestly say that everything on the menu is authentic and so good but if I have to choose one..my most favorite is the good ol' butter chicken.  It melts in your mouth!!  I take that nan bread and run it through the bowl to make sure I get every drop.  It's that good!

The owners (Rita and Ajeet) are absolutely amazing! Big props to the chef of course! If I lived closer, I'd probably eat there twice a week. But for now, I will settle with weekly visits :)
author: j m.

description: The MOST delicious lamb korma ever! Boyfriend and I enjoyed our meal, the lady who served us was very nice and attentive, and the art on the walls was cool to look at.  Cute pillows and one wall is a bench seat. We will definitely be back here next time we're in the city!
author: Clairene E.

description:
This place is rare combination of homey hospitality and great cooking. I think the reviewers who mention the cost were surprised because the atmosphere is so homey -- it does really feel like walking into a friend's house. 

Rita, the owner, bustled over to warn us that "spicy" really does mean SPICY, then came back to make sure everything was ok once we did get the dishes. And yes, they were definitely really spicy -- but not so much as to overwhelm the actual taste! I got the Chettinad goat curry and liked it so much I saved the sauce for later. I ate that sauce with Chinese dumplings (probably a cultural no-no, but, such a yummy no-no), then  steamed vegetables, then rice. It made *everything* better. 

We will be coming back.
author: Elizabeth G.

description:
Very disappointing after reading all the glowing reviews (although there's at least one fake - I mean, who posts the restaurant's publicity photos as if they're from a customer?).

Had Amritsari fish - batter was soggy, fish not fresh. Coconut fish curry was just oily and absolutely, totally, utterly flavorless - same borderline fresh fish, no decent use of spices or coconut. Tadka Daal was the one bright spot. Naan was average at best.

The service was very friendly, but prices are high.
author: Ritch G.

description: Exceeded all expectations!!! Keeva is truly amazing! Service is great and the food is extremely flavorful with a perfect atmosphere to suit the cuisine. The Chicken Curry Chettinad and the Palak Paneer are a must try!
author: Casey L.

description:
I come and visit from Socal often, and try to make it to Keeva's while I'm up here if possible. 

In my opinion this is honestly one of the better Indian restaurants I've been to states side. A major complaint I have with a lot of Indian restaurants in the US is that the curries start to all taste like variations of Tikka Masala with too many creams and too much liquid. Dishes at Keeva have all been very distinct tasting to me, with their iteration of Chicken Tikka Masala itself really standing out for having the spices more pronounced than an overflowing amount of bland cream and sauce. 

For me so far though, the real stand out has been their Dal Makhani, which has a delicious creamy, buttery texture but the spices and lentils tasting strong.In fact all of the vegetarian dishes have been surprisingly really stand out, such as Aloo Gobi Masala and I really recommend even the most ardent meat eaters to consider trying them. That said though, the Chicken Vindaloo is also delicious. The presentation of all of these dishes has been consistently wonderful as well.

I haven't tried any of the Tandoor Kebabs yet though I really want to.

I have to give particular note to Keeva's lunch special as well. A simple choice between a vegetarian or non vegetarian set of 3 sampler curries or paneers, a small bit of salad, and some rice and naan. For someone who likes meals made up of samplers like myself, it's a great and simple lunch.

I could maybe understand the criticism I've seen a few times that the food might be a bit too light for people who want heavier (and some would say more traditionally Indian) spiciness as the food's default is a little more of a locally palatable heat, however it is possible to ask for the spiciness of something to be upped upon ordering.

Service has been consistently friendly, prompt, and relaxed.

All and all, I really recommend giving this place a try if you can, as I believe it has the potential to be a local stand out in the Richmond area. It already stands out in a sea of bland cream curries.
author: Maximillian F.

description:
I am a very frequent yelp user but i don't really write reviews. I am an Indian and i really crave for yummy yummy Indian food. And on top of that i am a pure vegetarian. So here it goes.. its was 31st December 2016 and wanted to really have some food before going to watch fire works. And found this one on yelp. 

You must be wondering why i gave 5 star.  But trust me i had paneer tikka in appetizer and it was awesome- back to old days.. as i used to have in India. Malai kofta-- keeva knows what it has to be like.  The gravy is perfect.

The desert-- Ras malai . They actually made it. Ad you eat your first bite you realize it fresh made from scratch and not the frozen ones like other restaurants serve.. 

Thank you yelp for finding this restaurant for me and thanks Keeva for authentic Indian food.
author: Jharana M.

description: The food was delicious here! Really liked the potatoes and cumin dish here. Brings back memories of India. The nann was very nice and generous sized. We had medium hotness of 7 and that was a nice burn. Definitely go lower if you can't handle spicy. I also ordered the masala chai and at $4 a cup that's pretty pricy. You do get free refills. But I've had better chai. They have a lot of ginger in theirs and you have to add your own sugar. Next time I would pass on that but will definitely come back and try the other kinds of curry.
author: Carol L.

description: Took AN HOUR AND A HALF for our delivery order, and they were not apologetic at all. I don't care how good the food is, it's not worth waiting AN HOUR AND A HALF. I'd rather eat fast semi-good food vs slow amazing food any day.
author: Angelique G.

description: Fantastic meal and complex flavors. Service was a little slow but the perfectly seasoned masala and palak paneer was worth the wait. I will definitely explore other options on the menu next time!
author: ashley d.

description: Excellent Food! The ingredients are fantastic and the items are freshly made. We sampled a bit of everything, but I myself love the simple things. The raita had one of the best flavors of raita I have every tried. The veggie biryani was fantastic with fresh vegetables that were not sauteed into oblivion. We left feeling full and light - none of the heaviness of other Indian establishments. My husband and I loved it.
author: Nina G.

description:
I am so happy to see an Indian restaurant added to Clement street. I came here on a weekday afternoon. I ordered the veggie lunch plate and my friend got the meat lunch plate. Very good portions served in three separate bowls. Came with a salad and plain naan. Naan was excellent, warm and crispy. All the flavors were great

It got busier and it seemed like there was only one server so it took some time to get the food. Probably just working out the kinks of a new business. 

All in all I'll be back and would recommend this place. $28 plus tip.
author: Sam S.

description:
Came to Keeva with a group of 8 on a Saturday night. It's located very conveniently in the inner Richmond district of San Francisco (on Clement St.)

I ordered the butter chicken, which was very creamy and flavorful. The chicken was tender and juicy. We also shared orders of rice, plain naan, and garlic naan. Aside from the garlic naan, which was seasoned pretty well, the rice and the plain naan were very bland.

The service wasn't the best. The staff weren't very attentive to us. It also took a long time for the food to arrive.
author: Alvin W.

description:
Good food, tasty but limited lunch menu and long wait (for no reason)! I went on an empty Wednesday and there was one other person inside. Still my party of 4 sat waiting for 30 minutes for our food. Since it's already a set lunch menu (veg or no veg option) what was the delay? 
I would opt for take out in the future.
author: Nancy Y.

description: The most flavorful indian food in the city. Smoky, spicy, complex, deep. Next level service.
author: Ben B.

description:
Ordered through yelp!
Be warned the medium was soooo spicy that I could not taste the flavor of the actual food (I can handle spicy food)! 
What a waste. I was pretty excited to try the food based on all the reviews here.
author: K S.

description: Randomly came across this restaurant as I was walking in the Richmond area. I visited at lunch time on a day where they had only their specials going on, which were 2 combination platters of either veggie or meat. This was awesome since I was able to eat a bit of a variety. The combo came with generous portions and at $14 it was such a great deal.  Came with a side salad, chicken tikka masala, curry potatoes with cauliflower, some chickpea dish, naan, pappadums, and rice! Some of the best chicken masala lve had...very tender and cooked thoroughly the sauce had a thicker consistency which I prefer. The quality of the food was incredible and everything was so delicious. The service was wonderful as well as my server and other staff were friendly and attentive. I will be back!
author: Hoku L.

description: THIS PLACE WAS SOOO GOOOOOOD. 6 of us went, 4 entrees, 2 bowls of rice and 3 orders of garlic naan was more than enough. Medium certainly made us all break a sweat. Will be coming back!!
author: Mason B.

description:
Surprisingly a great find! One of the best authentic Indian restaurants in the Bay Area!! 
Great ambience, extremely friendly servers and delicious food! Dal makhani, bhindi, malai kofta and vegetable pakore were a few of my favorites!  
Definitely going there again soon! And highly recommend this place for good Indian food!
author: Kalyani B.

description: A M A Z I  N G A A A A A A A! Really good authentic Indian food...Gulab Jamun, Veg Hara Kebab was my fav :D
author: Ketan R.

description: I would post food pics but I ate too fast.  Ain't no one got time for that when you're hungry.  Best tempura spinach salad, coco curry shrimp and butta chxn I've ever had.  Eat with caution, their flavors will cause you to want more and it's coma inducing, the good kind.  Everything on their menu is just the right amount of spice, not overpowering at all.  I literally been eating Indian food wrong this whole time before keeva!
author: Sandra W.

description: Amazing food, great owners and once again, great food. We ordered Egg Curry, Chicken Biryani, Amritsari Fish and Garlic Naan and loved it!! Best Indian food in a long time.
author: Aaggrim S.

description: My wife and I travel to SF several times a year visiting our son and his family, and this dinner was our first meal at Keeva. From the pakoras as an appetizer to the gulab jamun as dessert, this Indian meal was the best my wife and I have enjoyed since leaving New Delhi in 1997.  Our group ordered a variety of items from the extensive menu. All items were delicious, but my favorites were the tandoori chicken and garlic naan. Rita and Ajeet were extremely hospitable.  We will definitely return to Keeva Indian Kitchen when we next visit SF.
author: Russ O.

description:
This is what I'd call a hidden Gem. They've been around for a few months and I am surprised they are not hotter than they currently are. 

The veggie kabab pattie was crunchy but soft on the inside. And the dips were perfect. 

We tried the dal makhani - nice, creamy smooth. Perfect. 

The paneer makhani had soft and silky paneer slices with chunky vegetables. Nice flavor and overall a fun dish. 

The Bang Bang egg curry was spicy!! And the gravy was well cooked, the way it is hard to do at home. 


Overall, everything was great, nothing disappointed, and each dish had its own distinct flavor. We wiped the bottom of each dish (cause it was so tasty , and we were a little hungry) 

Definitely coming here again .. soon.
author: Akshay S.

description:
Delicious and homey - Keeva is a lovely treat. 

Worth the wait on a Friday but probably better to come during brunch or during another week night. 

Rita is the heart and soul of this place and you get a sense of her passion in the food and how she runs things.
author: Charles V.

description: Delicious. This is some quality food. I had the lamb korma with regular naan. The lamb was great, and sauce was flavorful. A number of interesting spices, but still well-balanced. The naan was sooner if the best I've ever had. The family that runs it is super friendly too. I'll definitely be back.
author: Topher F.

description: Great food, run by a lovely family. I would stop by here for solid, interesting Indian food that tries to go above and beyond the norm. Definitely coming back for the great lunch special
author: Gregory I.

description: Great Food and Great service. This is our restaurant of choice a great little neigborehood gem.
author: Devin C.

description: Great food. Really friendly service. Feels like your local hang out spot. Samosa and tandoori wings are a must. Will definitely come back.
author: Amanda J.

description: Tried Keeva take-out for the second time tonight and unfortunately still really underwhelmed. The first time we asked for medium spicy and it was wayyyy too spicy for us. We wanted to give them another try because they're in our neighborhood and so we'll reviewed. Tonight we ordered everything mild, and honestly there just wasn't much flavor at all. Everything just tasted pretty greasy and bland. Ok for Indian food, but definitely not for Keeva's prices. Maybe it's an issue with to-go orders?
author: Emily T.

description:
Hella yums!

The food here is really great! The menu has a mix of staple dishes that we all love (samosa, chicken tikka), and many that I haven't encountered at other Indian restaurants (crispy okra, bang bang egg curry). We picked a few different dishes that we had never had before, and they were all delicious! We will definitely be coming back!

PS: The staff was awesome. Super nice people who clearly care about delivering the delish.

PPS: Excited to have some Indian food in the inner Richmond!
author: Hamza H.

description: This is the best Indian food in San Francisco. Everything from starters to entrees was delicious. Must try - fenugreek chicken and palak chat and Amritsar fish.
author: Akhil R.

description:
The food at Keeva is so fresh and bright. The flavors are delicate beyond belief. I've eaten a lot of Indian food in my life and have to say that this is on another level.

 Do yourself a favor and try this place out, invite some friends and enjoy!


 *Also great evening parking, as the bus stop directly in front of Keeva turns into available parking in the evenings!
author: Steve R.

description: Enjoyed a Birthday dinner at this wonderful family restaurant. Meal preparation and presentation was excellent. Dishes were served piping hot. Spice tends to be hot so I suggest starting with mild. The Lamb Rogan Josh , Samosas, and Lamb Korma were excellent. The owner was very friendly and was happy to discuss the preparation of her dishes. Lovely Clement St. spot.
author: George D.

description: This is a nice place with authentic and delicious  Indian food, personal is very nice and polite !
author: Lola U.

description:
We visited Keeva on the weekend and was really amazed at their spices and gravy that they use in their curries. It is a small place but like everything in San Francisco it is very authentic and its a new place to have good Indian food. 

We ordered their Vegetable Pakodas with cauliflowers  and onions and they were really crispy.

We ordered vegetable biriyani, palak paneer and malai koftha. Each of them was made fresh and they served us pretty quick.
author: Prasanth L.

description: I have been waiting for a while to try this place as I don't eat Indian as much as I previously did. And, based upon the reviews, I was kind of disappointed. Perhaps better than the few in the Richmond district, but not the best. We had the aloo ghobi which was pretty underwhelming, tomato/cilantro soup (okay to good), samosas (standard, but had a weird salt dusting), and some chicken briyani. I would say the latter was my favorite - nicely spiced, but could've been too much clove for some people. We ordered take out, which might have been the problem, and I am open to trying it again but stay in the restaurant.
author: Sarah A.

description: Keeva is so good. The food is insanely delicious and the service is top notch and so friendly. We don't go anywhere else for Indian food since we discovered Keeva. Every dish we've tried is wonderful. The lamb vindaloo and chicken tikka are my personal favorites.
author: Sarah G.

description:
5 stars for the rasmalai, possibly the best I've had. The hara bhara kebab was also very good. The dal makhni was good with the rice, but everything else was below average. The spinach was dry, and the egg curry was not as good as I thought it would be.

The restaurant was a bit cold throughout, particularly by the door where we were seated (and asked to be moved). However, the owners were very warm and nice, and they were helpful throughout.
author: Vikram N.

description:
So happy we stumbled into this place.  We've been looking for a new Indian restaurant after our neighborhood place changed owners.  We walked in to Keeva, and, !Surprise!, the previous owners of Saffron Grill (on Divis) have opened this new restaurant!  

This is a brand new place, so the menu has changed, but what I loved about Saffron Grill is still present at Keeva Indian Kitchen.  My entree (palak paneer) had a distinctly fresh quality that I always loved at Saffron Grill (saag paneer there).  Delicious naan, mango lassi, plenty left over for lunch the next day.

We'll definitely be back.
author: Jessica A.

description: If there were bonus stars, I would give them all to Keeva. My husband and I have come here at least once a week since we first discovered Keeva, and it's not even in our neighborhood. My honey ALWAYS orders the palek paneer. I rotate between a chicken dish or lamb roganjosh, and usually add in a third veg dish of bhindis, eggplant, or the aloo gobi. They are all fantastic. In the world of SF Indian food, I used to be a devoted Guddu follower (Guddu de Karahi, and Lahore Karahi back when Guddu still owned it). When Guddu closed shop in SF, I thought I'd never find Indian food I consistently loved again. Well, thank goodness that problem has been fixed! Additionally, I must give mad props to the staff at Keeva who - each and every visit- make us feel at home & provide prompt and attentive service. The price is higher than your tenderloin Indian restaurant classics, but the quality of the meat and veggies is well worth it. 10 Stars!
author: Jen H.

description:
This shop had been cursed by 2 very sub-standard Thai restaurants previously so I was excited to find out the change to Indian. Spoke with the owner, Rita, before they opened and she assured me it would be great food - which it most certainly was!

Lovely staff, extremely friendly and nice vibe. Food is delicious and definitely stands out in the Richmond as one of our go-to restaurants.

Would be there much more regularly (and give 5 stars) if they dropped the price just a tad.
author: Michael G.

description:
Keeva is relatively new, relatively inexpensive and provides pretty good food.  

A half tandoori chicken was nicely done and the bits of char here and there added to the taste.

Lamb vindaloo was moderately spicy and the lamb was moderately tender.  But for the price it was nice.

I did ask for the chicken and lamb to be served as two courses.  After a 30 minute wait both dishes came at the same time.  So at Keeva they favor "family dining", or what is most convenient to the kitchen but not the patron.
author: David D.

description: Chicken tikka curry was delicious, but the palak paneer was just ok. Would go back for the tikka, naan, and mango lassi. Also, you have to buy the basmati rice separately here, but the portion was generous, so a half order was sufficient for two of us (we also had naan).
author: Elisabeth C.

description:
This place came highly recommended by a friend today so I decided to check it out and was delighted. 

The Chicken Curry & Garlic Naan bread, was delicious and the atmosphere inside was fun (Sat night). Colorful lights, wine flowing, loud but not too loud. It'd be a great date spot.
author: Jacob N.

description:
I was unhappy about not finding a parking spot around this restaurant but had to walk all the way from 11th street; wondering if it was worth eating here.
They made it all worth it.
Tomato soup, biryani, curry and roti was awesome!!

We will comeback for Samosas for sure
author: Kris R.

description: Great service and delicious food!  Young lady welcomed us & gave excellent recommendations.   Spinach leaf appetizer was unbelievable.
author: Dave M.

description: We've eaten at the other Indian Restaurants in the areas and Keeva Indian Kitchen distinguishes itself for its friendly, local family-oriented atmosphere, and the food is awesome.   We had the chicken tikka masala,  an egg plant curry,  mango lassi,  nan  bread,  and samosa.  This definitely is our new favorite place.  Reasonably priced and deelish!
author: Jonathan W.

description: Loved the place ! Very good food, home style, beautiful art. Landed in sfo and headed straight to this place on a friends recommendation. Was not disappointed at all ! Highly recommend.
author: Vidhi Z.

description:
Short version: Hands down the best indian food I ever had and this includes the restaurants in india too.
Long version:
This restaurants take on the indian dishes is very creative, unique and delicious. For instance I was presented with spinach-samosa starter which tasted amazing and looked even better. The chef has a very creative approach for adding new fragrance and taste to the authentic indian dishes which is a big challenge since its very difficult to change the popular dishes that indians have been eating for a long time. The presentation of the food is world class, wont lie but even better than some Michelin star restaurants I have been to. If you are looking for a upscale indian dining experience, I would highly recommend you to check it out. Oh yes, do ask for Veg Biryani... I keep coming back for it all the time.
author: Shrey S.

description: We ordered for takeout. Everything was delicious but waaaaayyyy too spicy (and I'm Korean - I can handle heat). We ordered everything as medium spicy and our mouths and internal organs were burning. Definitely will come again but get it as mild!
author: Susan P.

description: Hands down my favorite Indian place in SF. Everything I've tried is fantastic, especially the Butter Chicken and Black lentils.
author: Kevin C.

description: Must go place if you want Indian food. The food is amazing, will rattle the tastebuds. The service is even better - another shout out to Rita the owner. We will be back!
author: Senya T.

description: Our party ordered chicken tika masala, okra curry, malai kofta, mattar paneer, naan and roti. It was all fine. Appreciated that food wasn't overly salty like many places. If I lived nearby, I'd probably try other things on the menu, but it didn't wow me enough to travel across town to eat here again.
author: L S.

description: I placed my order online to pick up at the restaurant. The email gave a clear time that the food was guaranteed to be ready by. Upon walking in to pick up the food, I did have to wait a few minutes. This isn't terribly bad, though. At least I knew my food wasn't sitting forever before I came to get it. The lunch specials are great, and I think you get a good bang for your buck with them. If only the lunch special included naan like their online picture shows.
author: S K.

description: Visited Keeva after reading several reviews and am happy to say the restaurant deserves very high ratings. The food is amazing and felt extremely home like. The space is cosy and warm. We had the okra and dal tadka along with mango chutney and were extremely satisfied. We didn't have any chicken or lamb though looking at the other tables they looked delicious. The wait staff were courteous and pleasant. They had an amazing song selection (old Bollywood songs) and my husband and I were humming to them and enjoying our dinner! :) Will definitely visit again.
author: Surbhi V.

description: One of the best Indian restaurants in the city. They cater for folks with nut allergy and other dietary needs.
author: Jay H.

description: One of the best Indian restaurants in the city. Visit here to indulge in some sumptuous and flavorful food. Try the Palak Chat appetizer.
author: Hemant J.

description: Amazing authentic Indian cuisine! If you are craving some great Indian food then make sure to stop by and enjoy a wonderful meal with your family. The owners are kind and welcoming! We can't wait to be back the next time we visit SF.
author: Hajar J.

description: Cozy Indian restaurant a little off the beaten path in San Francisco. Everything we ordered was full of flavor and presented well. A little pricey for Indian food but the portions were decent. Staff was very nice as well.
author: Dave S.

description: Coming from a tough Indian food critique, I would have to say this is the best in the city. The owners are very hospitable and the service is amazing. The saag paneer is my absolute favorite! Would recommend to anyone looking for a great atmosphere to dine in with even more amazing food!
author: Devin A.

description: Excellent food and the friendliest people! All the food is tasty and fresh: lamb korma, Tandoori chicken, butter chicken, naan...and an appealing okra dish (not spicy, which I appreciate this was the best-wrapped takeout ever...no leaks haha. Highly recommend.
author: Gale H.

description: Was a little scared given that the restaurant serves both Northern and Southern Indian food. Turned out much better than expected.
author: Johann W.

description: This place is really good if you want a quick bite of Indian food. The flavors are delicious and what makes it much more memorable is the staff. The staff is amazing and makes the whole dining experience better. I highly recommend trying them out. You won't be disappointed.
author: Shaneel A.

description: The freshest cleanest most authentic delicious Indian food from a restaurant. I had the naan, dal makhni, aloo Gobi, chicken tikka masala, and rice. The dal tasted homemade. The garlic and onion naan was crispy soft tasty! The potato cauliflower was not oily at all. The cauliflower was perfectly cooked. Everything was garnished with fresh cilantro. The chicken was perfectly cooked and the spices were just right. Rice was cooked to perfection where each grain was individual. Fantastic. I will definitely be eating there again. Kudos to the chef!
author: Keya K.

description: I have been wanting to try this place since it opened not too long ago as I work just a few blocks from here. So I finally decided to order pick up for lunch through Eat24. There were only 2 lunch specials, a non-vegetarian and a vegetarian option. I went for the non-veg option since it comes with chicken Tikka Masala! It also comes with cumin rice, Chana Masala, and a salad. It was $11 for this lunch special which was not too bad. As I went in to pick up my order, I was surprised to see that it was completely empty since it was during the lunch hour. But I didn't think too much of it since it is a newer restaurant and it has good Yelp reviews so far. I picked up my order, which was ready to go and brought it back to my office. My order was packaged inside a plastic black container and it was huge! I was surprised how much food there was and it smelled delicious! The chicken Tikka masala was juicy and packed full of flavor with the spices. This went great with the rice. The Chana Masala was also very tasty. And the salad was very refreshing. I was so full by the end of my meal, that I didn't eat dinner until almost 9pm. Lol. Anyways the lunch specials are definitely worth it and it can probably last you 2 meals! I only wish that they had more options for their lunch specials. Regardless, my coworkers now want to try out this place too.
author: Mary C.

description:
Amazing! We had a great dinner last night at Keeva Indian kitchen.  New-ish place on Clement Street and so glad that we came here.  We received a warm welcome when we walked through the door and had our choice of seats since it was still early evening.  They had nice pillows and table settings and the atmosphere was very homey.  They were also very accommodating to young kids.  The woman who greeted us and took our order (i'm assuming one of the owners) was awesome. Very friendly and came with paper and pen to occupy our hungry little ones while we waited for our food.
We ordered the Samosas and the Vegetable Hara Bhara Kebab for starters. Both dishes were delicious. But our favorite was the Hara Bhara Kabab. These were little crunchy fritters made with spinach, cheese and potato.  Every bite was delicious! My kids couldn't get enough of them so we ordered some to go.  The samosas were also wonderful, the crust was perfectly crispy and the filling was full of flavor and had a nice consistency. Not dry but not mushy either.
For the main course we had the Lamb Korma, Bhindi do Piazza (okra), Malai Tikka Kebab, Rice, Plain and Garlic Naan. 
The Korma was creamy and thickened with cashews, delicious! The lamb was tender and flavorful and not at all gamy.  My son couldn't get enough of the sauce, he scraped off every last bit with his naan.
We love okra and originally wanted the Cripy Okra but they are not currently making that at the moment so we went with the Bhindi do Piazza.  This dish was stir fried with onions, tomatoes and spices. Very good and had great flavor.  
The Malai Tikka Kebab surprised me in a good way.  We ordered this just in case the kids didn't want to eat the other dishes, but we all ended up fighting for the last piece.  It is boneless chicken in a creamy marinade and grilled to perfection.  It was juicy and full of flavor.
When the naan was brought to the table my kids both gasped because it came still steaming and gleaming with butter/ghee. they were chewy and crispy at the same time and great addition to the meal. 
Give this new restaurant some love and go here or get delivery.  If we still lived in the city this place would be a staple weekly meal.
author: Maria B.

description: You know when you have a group of 12 adults that go quiet for 30 minutes except to utter "mmmm", wonder which dish is goat, and ask to have dishes passed to them for seconds that you've hit a winner.  Keeva catered a graduation dinner to our active family reunion in San Francisco.  The food was delicious and everyone knew the few remaining prized left overs might even taste better the next day!
author: J B.

description: An amazing Indian restaurant with very friendly staff! Had a really good time there! The chef greeted us with a complimentary unique and well presented spinach-samosa starter which tasted even better than it looked. We were four people and all of us enjoyed the food! The chef also served us with an exceptional off-the-menu dessert upon request! Highly recommend going to this place if you are looking for authentic flavored Indian cuisine.
author: Krishna V.

description: If you want good Indian food come here! Excellent food, and awesome service! Highly recommended!
author: Yuriy G.

description: Visiting SF from New York and we were at Baker Beach after walking around all day and starving -- quick yelp search and found Keeva. Took an Uber and wow this was one of the best decisions of the trip! Not only did the owner and her family welcome us in with open arms but so did her beautiful children who were playing in the back (an added bonus in my opinion!) We felt as though we were at a friends house for dinner and the food was great. I think it was the best Lamb Korma I have ever eaten and that's including the Indian restaurants home in NY. Not only was the food great but we started up a conversation with the owner who took it upon herself to map out the rest of our trip with help from a nearby table of regulars. Great tips of local spots and it really helped us end our trip well. Not sure if I will ever be back in SF, but if I ever am, I will most certainly stop here again! Thanks again for your hospitality!!!
author: Joe C.

description: This place offers the best Indian food around :) Their appetizers were really good and nothing to talk about the main course :) Everything I ordered was really awesome and thanks a lot team :)
author: Avinash N.

description: There does not seem to be a lot of Indian restaurants in San Francisco compared to other cities I have visited. Tried this place and it was very good. Friendly service and reasonable prices for great curries.  What more could you ask for?
author: John P.

description: Incredibly delicious food, with friendly and delightful service.  We found our new favorite Indian restaurant in SF!
author: Lori C.

description: Best Indian food I have had in the bay area. This is the kinda of authentic Indian food I grew up eating and Keeva has nailed it in all areas - taste & presentation.
author: Nilesh H.

description: Great food but beware of the spice levels - love spicy food but medium spice was more than I could handle
author: Cheston L.

description:
Absolutely delicious! Good friends shared this favorite restaurant and ordered a range of items for us to try. I loved every dish we ordered. Some of these I know I won't find at any other Indian restaurant. 

Aside from the Chai tea, the starter soup Tomato Dhaniya Shorba (which I must learn how to make), we ordered these standout plats:
 - Vegetable Hara Bhara Kebab (delectable puffs of spinach, cheese and potatoes)
 - Malai Kofta Curry (rich and creamy with potato dumplings)
 - Bang Bang Egg Curry (hearty and addictive)
 - and a dish that I don't see listed on the menu, but must be Palak Chaat, or similar spinach salad. Basically flash fried spinach piled high on a plate with drizzles of cream and another (cilantro or mint?) sauce, sprinkled with pomegranate seeds. You must ask for this one...it's amazing! 

At this point, I'll have to go back because I won't get the same Spinach or Tomato Shorba anywhere else. And I need to try out some of the other dishes folks are raving about.
author: Christine B.

description:
Food was delicious, and came to our table super fast!  The aromas and colors of the food are vibrant. Definitely receive the home cooked meal vibe. 
Staff were friendly and attentive with check-ins and water refills. That being said, there were not many patrons eating. I think they could do well if busy. 

I'm so sorry I couldn't give it the full 5 stars. The portions were small for the costs.
author: Jodi S.

description: Good, tasty food at a not exorbitant price. All the food is tasty and genuine, without too much cream and stuff that a lot of North Indian styled restaurants put in the dishes to fancy them up. Our absolute favorite is the tandoori chicken. It is cooked on the bone, so it stays moist.
author: Uday W.

description: I wanted a quick bite and ordered their wings.  It came with a tasty side salad.  The wings were delicious.  Not a fried wing, but a grilled wing coated in a curried sauce.  I'm definitely coming back here to try their other dishes.  If it's as tasty as their wings, they get 5 stars and one of the better indian restaurants I've tried here in SF.
author: John M.

description: We rolled into town late after an 11 hour drive, the stars aligned and found Keeva. We were a little apprehensive trying a newer Indian place on the first night of our vacation but we blown away by how amazing our experience was. Our server offered many great recommendations and our order was on the table quick. Midway through our dinner the chef bright out a special dish on the house. Everything was absolutely fantastic! Easily the best Indian I've ever had. The restaurant is clean, decor is tasteful and the service was outstanding. I'd make the 11 hour drive all over again for some more Tikka Masala and coconut curry shrimp!
author: Katie A.

description: Keeva is the only Indian restaurant we have been to in SF as we were visiting for a few days.  The owner and staff were excellent and treated us so well even though we had two toddlers throwing tantrums at the same time.  They brought us crayons, lassi and plastic spoons to help with them to no avail.  The food itself was good.  Our only complaints were that the butter chicken and lamb rogan josht came with less than expected meat.  The other complaint is that we wished we were informed that the samosa was spicy.  We did not know and gave our hungry toddlers two bites, which started the collective meltdown.  Lastly, for those not from the area, parking is quite difficult.  Ideally, I'd give them 4.5 stars, but that is not an option.
author: George S.

description: Every time I've been to Keeva, I've left full and happy! The atmosphere is light and welcoming and the food is delicious. I've been able to try many dishes and can say that everything has been tasty and beautifully plated.
author: Jen F.

description: I finally tried this place after several friends raved about the food. Definitely deserves five stars since 7 of us inhaled every single dish. None of us spoke for several minutes since we were too busy eating every morsel. Standouts: Butter chicken, Tandoori Chicken, Pakora, Lamb Vindaloo, Crispy Okra, Bang Bang Egg Curry.  Frankly, you cannot go wrong with any dish. All were extremely tasty! Highly recommend this place.
author: Myra Y.

description:
Visited Keeva Restaurant last weekend. It was one of the most authentic north Indian food I had in SF bay area. Bang bang egg curry, Malai kofta were really delicious and must try. 
Servers were courteous and prompt. 
Overall a great place to have Indian food in SF.
author: Ved P.

description: I love Indian food and this restaurant didn't disappoint. Great food, great service and good prices.
author: Mariam M.

description: The best! I eat here or get delivery at least once a week. Everything on the menu is delicious. My favorite is the lunch plate. Three dishes served with rice and nan and a perfectly crisp papadam. Love it!!!
author: Jenny J.

description: Absolutely delicious! My husband and I were craving Indian, so we decided to give this place a try after reading rave reviews. So happy we did! The chicken tikka masala was probably the best I've had. Generous portions and very reasonably priced. Will definitely go back!
author: Andrea C.

description:
Amazing restaurant and great food! Totally recommend everything

ESP bang bang egg curry
author: Amit D.

description:
Food is awesome, starters are okay though,chicken tandoori  is juicy and perfectly cooked and well presented an well completed with salad.
Goat chitinad Curry is perfectly blended wilts required spices and well completed with rice.

Finally rasmalai is filled with foam ,rose  flavor and elachi Made my stomach satisfied.
author: Kalyan M.

description:
Authentic Indian food with great ambiance!

A must have if u r in SF! Delicious food, great atmosphere, really friendly owner and staff!
author: Mitul h.

description: caught up w a friend here for lunch. lovely! yummy food, nice atmosphere, friendly staff.
author: BayArea L.

description: WINNER. Cannot speak higher of this place. Spoke with Rita (owner) at length about this relatively new restaurant. Extremely friendly and passionate about the food and restaurant. Primarily northern indian cuisine. Really enjoyed the curries that we ordered. Lamb curry and tika masala particularly on point. Cant wait to come back and try a few more dishes. This will be an indian restaurant that I will frequent. Been on the hunt for a decent one in the city and this one hit the spot. Not many tables so be prepared to wait if you come during prime dining hours. How have so many SF-ers already found out about this gem?!
author: Anna M.

description: Really delicious Indian - haven't found too many of these in sf. Good traditional menu, great for family style. Also they have some interesting apps like yogurt sauce spiced tandoori wings... those were mmmm. Dal makhani was solid, as was the chicken curry and alou mutter. Portions aren't too big so order plenty
author: Rohan S.

description: Keeva gets the award for best Indian in San Francisco, according to me! I've been to India, and THIS is authentic! They were accommodating when I asked for something off the menu, "Of course we can make that!" Friendly and warm staff.
author: emily p.

description: Delicious food, they even cooked up something just for me due to food restrictions I currently have.
author: Lalit K.

description:
For someone who is from India and knows what Indian food is. Out of 5* rating scale:

Ambience: 4*
Food: 1*
Authenticity: 1*
Service: 3*
Warmth: 3*

Appetizers were cold. Chicken was boiled and dropped in sauce. Level of service was low. Owner seem to be concentrated more in chit chatting. Daal tadka was actually yellow moong dal. Not the actual toor daal.

They should concentrate more on service and food quality rather than trying to specialize. This isn't a meet up. It's a restaurant.
author: Chintu B.

description: Neighborhood gem.  Delicious flavors.  Top quality presentation.  Originality, creativity, and uniqueness in all dishes, even in the traditional.  Excellent friendly service.  Once you go, you will become addicted.  Prize appetizer is the spinach in garbanzo batter. Their Nan is also different!  Go!
author: Emily G.

description:
New place that I'm so happy we found and has decided to open in our neighborhood.  I give it a two thumbs up and five star rating all together. 
We had the goat (off the bone) curry and the yellow lentil curry with plain naan and jasmine rice.  Both were excellent.  Flavorful and full of aromatic spices, I was blown away.  Everything is fresh and a lot of heart and passion is put into the cooking of the food.  Service was friendly and prompt, which always makes for a happy customer.  The owner came and talked to us after we paid the bill (which was below $40 which is unheard of in SF for an amazing dinner or any dinner for that matter) and he chatted with us and asked what we thought, etc.  My boyfriend and I were very impressed and will easily frequent this establishment.  Great job you guys
P.s. 
The little shots with pomegranate and rose petals at the end are super delicious (think of a sweetened milk tea).  A nice icing on the cake.  Bravo
author: Heidi B.

description:
So much YUM.

Ordered butter chicken, crispy okra, pakora, goat biryani, bang bang egg curry - all hella good

Ended with really delicious mango lychee panna cotta, and a vanilla drink in a shot glass.

Owners are super friendly, and local!
author: Erika C.

description: Inner Richmond had no good Indian food, until this spot opened up. Tried the chicken tikka and coconut shrimp curry and it was bomb! Same with the garlic nan. Gotta try the mango lassi as well!
author: Daniel A.

description: We came on a Wednesday for lunch. The ambience and service were great. Can't say much for the food though. They only had veg and non veg lunch specials. The veg special had 3 curries, naan and rice. Nothing was extra ordinary. Would not recommend the place
author: Nisha H.

description: Best indian food i had in San Francisco !!! everything was great , palak chat and coconut fish curry was beyond expectation ,will highly recommend this place ,nan was fluffy and flavourfull.
author: Faby T.

description: We felt pleasantly surprised by this spot. The walls are beautifully decorated, the staff are super fun and friendly (their fun personalities really shine through), and the food is excellent. I'll come back!
author: Carlos C.

description: Our favorite go to Indian restaurants in the inner Richmond area.  Their bang bang egg curry is my personal favorite. Must try!
author: Shreyas S.

description: Every single thing was fantastic! Before we even got our food, I was in love with this place. Genuine / authentic interactions with the wait staff made for a lively dining experience. And the food was aaaaamazing. Can't wait to go back!
author: Tammy M.

description: 45 minutes later, we just walked away. We arrived at 8 and ordered a couple of dishes, asking explicitly "please bring them as they are ready, we are so hungry". We were told that was not needed, everything was coming out together... 45 minutes passed and I decided to leave.
author: Felipe B.

description:
This has become our favorite Indian Restaurant in San Francisco!

For the past 3 years, we've been searching for some good indian food in San Francisco; most of what we've found was only ok. Well that all changed when we found Keeva; we love it. Never have I had Indian food that was simultaneously so fresh tasting, while being so flavorful. We've now been there 3 times and each time was better then the last time. To boot, it's such a family friendly place and the owners and waitresses are so friendly and helpful; it always feels like they take extra special care of us. 

Definitely try Keeva; it's fantastic!
author: Joel D.

description: Fantastic! They will make it less spicy unless you ask for spicy. They treated us very well. The Indian food selection was great, everything we got was so delicious. The service was excellent, they even gave me a free glass of wine and free veggie tempura! So glad we have an excellent Indian Restaurant in the Richmond now.
author: Jackson W.

description: The food was 100% homemade and fresh. The service was impeccable and the atmosphere lovely, but it just wasn't that good, hence only the three stars. I had the chicken tikka masala with naan, my go to Indian food order. The sauce was too thick and the herb balance not quit right. I wish I had liked it more since it's such a lovely place, had ingredient of quality and tasted like small batches made with care.
author: Julia M.

description:
I had wanted to give this restaurant top reviews as there is no really good Indian food in
the Richmond. We usually go to Roti in West Portal for Indian food. 
The food portions are very generous. I would have rated the food four, but my wife did not like much of what we ordered finding the fish too greasy and some of the vegetarian dished with
things that did not taste good.
They show pint beer servings and the price is set accordingly.  A pint is sixteen ounces but
they serve beer in eleven ounce bottles.  That is a ripoff and probably contrary to the law.

They show a number of fish dishes on the menu. However, they only had some fried, farmed, fried tilapia which was a very generous portion which my wife found to be too greasy.
They claimed they didn't like to buy fish because they never knew how much to order and they didn't want to over order because they would wind up throwing it out.  They have one of the best fresh fish markets in San Francisco right across the street from them that is even open on Sundays.  Their prices are 30-50% below shops whose freshness and quality are hard pressed to meet.  It wouldn't be that difficult to walk across the street and pick up fish once guests order.
They need to get their act in order and run this as a business or they will not be around very long.
author: michael s.

description: We tried this place last night and were very impressed. It's great to finally have an Indian restaurant in that neighborhood, which is dominated by Chinese, Japanese, and Vietnamese cuisine. Our server was really personable and even recommended some of the dishes we ordered over others we were considering. She seemed to tune into our tastes that night. They were fairly busy, so service was slightly inattentive, but they really made up for that fact with the tastiness of the food and the friendliness of the staff. We ordered the veggie hara bhara kebab (her recommendation - delicious and satisfied our fried craving), the palak paneer (their paneer is to die for, so creamy), the veggie biryani and the garlic naan with a side of raita. Before we knew it we had eaten our fill and we're sitting there with happy tummies. Highly recommend trying this place out.
author: Jenna K.

description: Waited 45 minutes for the food to arrive after we ordered. Understaffed and highly unorganized
author: Prashant B.

description: Some of the better Indian food I've had in San Francisco. Prices are very reasonable, although slightly higher than other Indian restaurants in the city, but totally worth it. They have all the traditional dishes, but also had some dishes I had never heard of which were delicious. I was pleasantly surprised by the okra and would highly recommend it!
author: Jennifer C.

description: Good value for great food, highly recommend for pickup or dine in. Even my 2.5 year old loves all the options.
author: Shaun G.

description: Stopped in for lunch and I'm so glad I did. I got their Chicken Tikka Masala lunch combo that also had an okra dish, and a garbanzo bean (channa masala) - omg sooooo delicious. Also, do not miss out on the chai tea! Super friendly staff - Rita is one of those people you feel like you've known your whole life. I went back for dinner with a bunch of friends the next day and we all ordered several dishes to share - everything was deelish. Nice cozy vibe. Putting this place into heavy rotation.
author: Kelly C.

description: Best new addition to Clement St! I've been waiting a long time for some delicious Northern Indian cuisine in the neighborhood. Finally- thank you Keeva! Rita and Ajeet know how to make the dining experience personable and fun. Can't wait to get back. More Butter Chicken please!
author: Holly S.

description: delicious and beautiful food, friendly atmosphere. lots of unique dishes. definitely the best indian food i've had in bay area!
author: Danielle Z.

description:
Newly opened. People there are really friendly and personable. Good service with a smile. Very unique India food well beyond the standardized Americanized food you find at other india restaurants.
We had the india eggplant with peanut based sauce and the goat curry (very tender) with plain naan (it was good, so we had to try their garlic naan which was even better).
Chicken Fenugreek, 10 hour cooked house special lentils, etc.. yummmmy sounding. Will need to try next time along with host of other goodies.
author: Nan W.

description: This is the best Indian food I've  had in a long time.  Maybe the best Indian food I've ever had.   I went for lunch with a friend.   The lunch special was $13 for the veggie and $14 for non veggie.  It was more than enough food.  We left with our bellies stuffed and with some leftovers. We met the owner Rita. She is awesome!  She even entertained my 1&1/2 year old daughter for a while so that I had some free time to eat.   I'll definitely be back.
author: Jeff H.

description: Nice ambiance, tasty food and lots of options. We had the muttar paneer, chicken vindaloo and garlic naan. All delicious and fresh. They even brought out a yummy dessert on the house. I couldn't tell you what was in it, but I'd eat it again anytime. Super glad this place is in the hood and hope they do well. I'll be back!
author: Kerry S.

description: Delicious food, after so long time I got a place where I can find authentic Indian food. Highly recommended
author: Nikhil J.

description: I ABSOLUTELY LOVE, LOVE this place! I just had my 21st birthday party here yesterday- and it was definitely the first one they have ever hosted. But, I couldn't have been more happier: from Rita and Jaya's amazing service and Ajeet's amazing food! They were and possibly are now like part of the family! The food was amazing! The atmosphere was amazing! Everything was perfect! I promise, this place is worth the try, not only will you have a great time with Rita! But amazing food to fill your tummy with as well! Huge thank you to Keeva!!!
author: Urmi P.

description:
So good!  The neighborhood is in desperate need of some diversity in dining options. For months (years?) I have prayed for either a taqueria or an Indian restaurant to move into my section of Clement. My prayers have been answered!  I used to drive all over the city to find decent Indian food, and magically, some of the best I have had has moved in a couple of blocks from home. 

Not only is it something new, the food is fabulous. The dal and chicken chettinad were fantastic, and the sauce for the eggplant was incredible. The food is well crafted and authentic, each dish has been well thoughtout. Don't ask to modify recipes by asking for something to be made more spicy, ask for a different dish. The chef knows what he is doing, if a dish was meant to be spicy, it would be. 

To top it all off, the family that run it are so nice.  So excited to work my way through the entire menu.
author: Scott T.

description: I have had Indian food a lot of places. Not much can top Indian in London, but this place does! Hands down the best Indian food EVER!!!! Service was amazing, take all advice the staff gives you. All the spices are hand roasted and ground in house. This places is beyond amazing! Please go!!!
author: Alicia J.

description: The food here is DELICIOUS, beautiful, and you can tell it's made with love. My husband and I are kind of obsessed with Indian food and this place has captivated us. The menu offers more variety than the usual options, and everything is presented with a lot of thought and an artistic eye. The ambience is lovely as well, with stenciled walls, original artwork, and comfy pillows to recline on. Our meal was great, but even better was the rasmalai. I'm a huge fan of Indian desserts, and this one was the best I've had, and a very refreshing end to a decadent dinner.  Go, eat, enjoy!
author: Suzanne H.

description: Just found this place! EVERYTHING we had is delicious. So happy to have found this in our neighborhood. Staff is awesome, clean, awesome, awesome, awesome. I almost didn't write this because I don't want it to get busy here when everyone finds out how good it is.
author: Midori H.

description: So excited that Keeva has opened up so close by, definitely a great addition to Clement St! My husband and I have now been here three times and loved everything we've had. Rita and the other staff are so friendly and helpful. We'll definitely be returning regularly.
author: Phil W.

description: Cold, tired, and hungry after our fist day of the 2016 Hardly Strictly Bluegrass, we stumbled into Keeva for a quick bite last night. Immediately we felt at home. It was lovely and warm and friendly. Being a reluctant vegetarian, I was so happy to see so many vegetarian options. I'm only reluctant because we vegetarians are so rarely given options! We loved the lentils and eggplant curry. I've never had pakora before this but had to fight off my family for the last bits. Finicky son, was still talking about the samosas this morning. Can't wait to go back tomorrow for box lunches to take back to the festival.
author: Maria C.

description: Absolutely delicious! Keeva is a welcome addition to our neighborhood. Lots of classic go-tos and plenty of unique dishes to keep foodies intrigued too. The staff is warm and friendly, and accommodating to children. We loved our experience and plan to come back soon.
author: Jennifer R.

description: Delicious! I love the tandoori chicken. The samosas are spicy but amazing. I also love the bang bang curry. Really good service. Food comes a little slow but it is worth it.
author: Diana L.

description: Came here on a whim with a friend , starving , tired, and looking for something  new. Stepped into Keeva and everything was bomb as hell!! Honestly my new favorite Indian joint. The waitress was amazing. She had a great personality and had us laughing for days. I ordered the Paneer Tikka Masala ( best tikka masala I ever had) . Egg curry and lamb biranyi. All of it was so good. I still dream about the masala sauce. I will most def be coming back here when I'm in the neighborhood. And I hope they don't change any recipes. The spice is the best!
author: Jackie N.

description: WOW! This place is ridiculously good! These guys know how to build their curries. I don't Yelp...ever, but I was so in love with the food that I had to get on and write a little blurb. I'm a chef here in the city and these guys are crushing it, the flavors here are all on point. They build their curries to order and you can feel the love in every gravy, every piece of naan. Get a table with those sexy ass Indian pillows and enjoy the beautiful murals. Girrrrl! Go get your curry on!
author: David M.

description: Excellent Restaurant in the Richmond. Great Indian food that's super comforting and satisfying. Tasty dishes which I crave. Friendly service too! So happy to have this restaurant nearby!
author: Liz O.

description: Love!! So happy to find this place. Indian is our family go-to and we are so tired of the bland flavorless dishes most places serve. This place is full of really interesting spices and flavors on even the most common of dishes.
author: Sara W.

description: Absolutely a phenomenal Indian restaurant! Went here with my good friend for a birthday celebration, this place caters to groups and even couple dates. Everything I've had was delicious and reasonably price! Definitely coming back!
author: Mickelangelo P.

description:
As a half Desi couple we eat Indian food frequently, including cooked at home.  Keeva is now our favorite new Indian place. We had a delicious chicken that had been marinated and then cooked in the tandoori oven, okra in a mildly spicy sauce, a hotter dahl (lentils), rice, and nan (bread).  It was all delicious.  For dessert we had the best version of ras malai any of us has had, with a whipped foam flavored just right with rose water.  Excellent masala chai to drink, even Thumbs Up cola for our son, who was easily served things in his not too spicy range.  We chatted with the owner and the chef, both of whom were most gracious.

There's no doubt;we'll be back
author: Bruce S.

description:
First time in sfo and first Indian restaurant i wanted to try. It was 2 15 pm and most of the rest. close for lunch post 15 mins. I called up for pickup and i was kept on hold for 12 mins. Intermittently i talked to 4 different people to put on an order. Finally got to hear that they just got a group of people in for lunch so they wont take our order. 
Thats it no indian options left for me just because Kaveena wants to crack orders with big profits only. I just hope they dont treat people the same way if they are there in rest.
author: Animesh P.

description: Everything we ordered was tasty from the samosas and amritsari fish appetizer to the aloo gobi, palak paneer, chicken tikka kebab, and garlic naan.  Presentation is simple and well done.  Brass flatware is a nice touch.  Will come again when we are in the area.
author: Angelo S.

description: We came back! One of the best indian restaurants in the city! The creativity and flavors bring me back to the motherland. I was so tired of having same ol' thai or pizza every day, so I was very happy when Keeva opened up in the Inner Richmond area! A really nice, young couple own this restaurant with their cute little daughter. They're super sweet and extremely nice! You \'ll feel like your having dinner in someone's home when you dine at Keeva. Some of the highlights you have to try are, the tandoori, okra, chicken curry and biriyani all had distinct flavors were extremely delicious! You can tell the main chef takes such love and care for each dish they put out. Very traditional with explosive flavors! You won't be disappointed!
author: Priya K.

description:
Amazing food! We had 4 dishes and everything was delicious- flavorful, chicken was tender and juicy! 

Great family business- Rita is super sweet! Will definitely come back for the authentic Indian food and wonderful service!
author: Jennifer C.

description:
It has been 2+ years since I moved to Inner Richmond and there wouldn't be a day that I would not crave for some Indian food. When I say Indian food I mean "Authentic Indian food". I have frequented most of the Indian/Pakistani places in SF and other parts of the Bay Area and being an SF resident I wouldn't always want to drive all the way to South Bay or Fremont/East Bay for some "good desi khana". With Keeva setting shop in my neighborhood I can say that my hunt is over. 
They have the right mix of vegetarian and non-vegetarian dishes. The appetizers would make you want more, especially their Veg Hara Bhara Kebab. On the main course I would highly recommend Chicken Vindaloo and Chicken Chettinad. And if you are craving for some tandoori then Tandoori Chicken and their special Tandoori Wings are must haves. We also had a chance to try their Channa Masala and Crusted Cumin potatoes and we were for sure not disappointed. The biryanis are great too and if you become a regular or have small parties then Ajit (the owner) and the chef can whip up some special items on request. We once had Chicken Dum Biryani on request-to-order and it was really good. 
Keeva is a must try for anyone who yearns for some mouth watering Indian fare. Once you have been here you would want to go back again and again for its Authentic Indian food - with a twist :)
author: Siddharth P.

description: Just left from the most flavorful, fresh, beautifully-presented Indian food we've had in SF! I highly recommend all the chicken dishes we enjoyed: tandoori, tikka masala, and fenugreek. The eggplant & okra were also excellent. The owner is so friendly, sweet, & witty. The place is kid-friendly, had no wait on Sunday at 5:30, and wasn't too hard to park at.  The portions might be smaller than other Indian joints but the quality is far, far superior! So good!
author: Kari F.

description: Amazing flavor, friendly service, easily one of the best Indian restaurants in San Francisco. You can order anything on the menu and it is a great choice.
author: Cameron C.

description: We tired the Malai Kebab, Bang Bang egg curry and Rasmalai...everything was excellent... the Malai Kebab... is a must try... service is great...the food a pretty cool spin on it not regular affair... but still pretty good!!! The presentation of the food was good...
author: Sachin K.

description: Very homely place with good Authentic Indian food. Owners are friendly and explain the menu very well. If you need to try local cusines from India do try this place. A good addition to the area. Waiting from a long time for good Indian food
author: Dhiren P.

description: Hole in the wall, wait on a Saturday night was prob 15 minutes. Service was great, the table split CTM and Butter Chicken (the whitest entrees of all time) and they were incredibly delicious. Best Indian food I've had in SF so far.
author: Jordan S.

description: I was going to y&y Vietnamese but they were closed for Chinese new year. I was hungry so I figured I give this place a try. Ordered a chicken tikki marsala. It was OK but definitely small portions and for the price it isn't worth it. I can go to naan and curry and get better and cheaper. Also I guess everyone was in the kitchen when I came in. So I tryed to get Their attention for five minutes they couldn't hear me. I mean common you should be aware of your customers coming in.
author: J C.

description:
Really good food. 

We were 5 people and ordered food to share. We got a chicken tikka masala, a chicken kadhai, paneer kadhai, 2 garlic naans, a roti, an onion naan, a veg biryani, and a lamb biryani. 

Everything was very delicious. The service was quick, and the staff friendly. 

I will definitely visit the place again. 

Well deserved Five stars.
author: Indrajit K.

description: Best Indian food in the city!! Everything is beautifully presented and extremely delicious. Must try the lentils!
author: Haley B.

description: Great appetizers.  The Tandoori Chicken Wings were the best wings I've ever had.  Really.  The lunch meal comes either Vegetarian or with Chicken Tikka.  Good size, kinda pricey, but super high quality.  It's worth it, and that's the fact about Indian food in San Francisco.  It's not always the best, but when it's good, it's expensive.  Cafe is toward the end of the high part of Clement, so parking...  They offer Indian wine by the glass!  Interesting.
author: Gregory R.

description: Keeva has hands down the best Indian food I've ever had in my life, and the service couldn't be better. Order the lentils, they are the best you'll ever have!
author: Zoe B.

description: This is the best Indian food in the city! love the tandoori wings
author: Nick D.

description: Amazing! Best Indian I've had in the city. Highly recommend the chicken tikka masala as well as the butter chicken. The service was exceptional and the food was out quickly. Casual vibe and great neighborhood feel.
author: Kylie H.

description: Food arrived cold and i'd rather order indian food from other places... The palak paneer (spinach) tasted awful... the other stuff was okay!
author: Sarai F.

description: So good! My favourite Indian restaurant in the city. Malai kofta, hara bhara kebab and eggplant curry are to die for!
author: Ayush K.

description: This place rocks. Only ever ordered it on UberEATS, but definitely the best Indian food I've had in my 8 years in the Bay Area.
author: Nick E.

description: What a disappointment. First, they took an hour to deliver. Then, the portions were extremely small and the Chicken Tikki Masala maybe had three pieces of chicken. Nan/rice was limp and tasteless. I called several times to complain, but no one picked up. Never again.
author: jeff w.

description: Great little place in the Richmond District! I routinely travel all over the Bay Area looking for good Indian food,  the kind of North Indian food that won't make me fall into a deep slumber afterward. Either I end up cooking at home, or end up at a Nepalese place when I want something decadent, but not heavy. Finally, a place in the City I can recommend! It was my first time there this evening, but a total hit! And the owners are super friendly and fun too.
author: Manisha K.

description: Malai Kofta is amazing. Made fresh, not pre cooked in the morning and heated up at night. They make it fresh on the spot which is why it takes some time for the food to come out once you've ordered. Caters to the more authentic Indian taste than other places in the city. Garlic naan and tandoori rotis are good. Good ambience with light slow Bollywood music in the background. Great service. Mango lassi is not too thick, not too thin. Love this place!
author: Aneesh K.

description: RITA!!! she owns this new restaurant. She knows her stuff; food and service. I'm a complete Indian food snob and unapologetically so. The food here is authentic and delicious. The recipes remind me of some of the best places I've eaten in India including at homes of friends in Punjab! Try them out and you'll love them! Fabulous food. Rita is here. You can't miss her loving, funny, welcoming attitude as well as attention to detail! Best Indian food in SF hands down.
author: Nikki P.

description: THIS PLACE IS AMAZING!! My friend introduced me and I LOVE IT!!! The plates are amazing and there is such a range to choose from. The chef does an amazing job with not only the food but the presentation as well! The staff is so friendly and accomodating, I cannot wait to go back! DEFINITELY RECOMMEND! 5 + stars!
author: Cari W.

description: Awesome food! the goat curry was amazing! love the staff. Rita and Ajeet will make you feel like family. highly recommended!
author: P S.

description: I finally ate in their restaurant (as opposed to delivery) and their bread IS quite tasty.  It must not travel quite as well as the rest of their food. :)  Anyway, so delicious!  Stop in or order in. :)
author: Bianca G.

description: So happy to have this place in the hood.  The Dahl makhani is superb.  Naan, meh.  But every entree I tried was uniquely spiced.
author: Mabel E.

description: I love this place and the owners.  I have a bias against most Indian Restaurants as i have incredible Indian cooks in my family.  Every dish my family and I tried at this place was fantastic.  Appetizers, Main Course and Dessert, all were fantastic.  The owner even made a few dishes for us that were not on the menu.  Seriously taste and quality of food drive my family of foodies and this is our favorite Indian restaurant in the city.
author: Piyush P.

description: Great place with very nice tandoori food, need to try chicken wings with an Indian twist!
author: Maynd J.

description: Live the curries and naan. We went in a weekend and the place was slammed but we got great service. We will be back
author: Laxmikanta S.

description: Wonderful food, presented beautifully.  The owners greeted us and were very welcoming.   We asked if they had a specific lamb dish on the menu, and they did not, but the chef/owner made it for us.    The tomato/cilantro soup was amazing.   Great restaurant!
author: Vicky L.

description: This little gem offers some of the tastiest Northern Indian cuisine in the city. Tucked away on Clement street it's a welcome addition to the neighborhood! It has a cozy atmosphere with some very cool and colorful artwork and decor. I went there yesterday with a friend of mine and we started off with the pakoras which were very tasty. I ordered for myself the butter chicken along with garlic naan. The sauce was so flavorful along with the tender chicken. I had to order more naan to sop up the rest of the sauce! My friend ordered a vegetarian dish of lentils (which I forgot the name of) along with some rice which he said he enjoyed. We also shared a half order or tandoori chicken (also comes in whole) and that bird was so juicy! The spices and flavors were spot on but I was was really impressed how the tender the chicken was. The chicken also came with a spot of salad on the side which was enough as a refresher. The service was great and Rita, our server, was so friendly and helpful with the menu. Overall Keeva is a great Indian restaurant and if you're looking for some tasty and spicy comfort food, this is the place. I will definitely be a repeat customer there!
author: Jeffrey N.

description: Really solid food in a festive atmosphere.  The staff was great, too.  We had the chicken tikka masala, the lamb korma, daal and naan.  All of it was so well done. I highly recommend.
author: Emily C.

description: Staff was super friendly. Rita, the owner, was very courteous to make sure the food was to our liking.  We enjoyed the food and the atmosphere here.  Give Keeva a try.
author: Franciscus W.

description: Food was amazing! The bang bang egg curry, malai kofta, n most of all the Keeva were yummilicious! Rasmalai was also very fresh n yummy. Must go!
author: Vysyaraju C.

description: Absolutely loved the food. Loved the bhindi, egg curry and rasmalai. This is undoubtedly the best Indian food in SF.
author: Sai P.

description: Absolutely awesome! This is my favorite Indian restaurant in all of US, no other Indian restaurant even comes close. I avoid going to Indian restaurants in SF, most of them are below average, especially because I can make great Indian food at home. We had the classic lamb curry, bang bang egg curry, pakoras, amritsari fish, lamb biryani & naans on two different days. They are well spiced, delicious and not over the top. We are regulars now, we love this place.
author: Sujata M.

description: A++! Fresh, flavorful and plentiful. Amidst a city of Indian buffet lunch options, it's a treat to have freshly prepared, bright & colorful, aromatic and tasty Indian food and at a comparable price. Everything was delicious and the presentation was top notch. My wife and I each ordered one of the lunch selections (veggie or non-veggie) and shared. Each came with a green salad, basmati rice, pakora, naan and three (yes, three!) dishes.  So nice to have this addition in the neighborhood. We also enjoyed chatting with Rita, the owner. Very friendly! We look forward to our next meal at Keeva.
author: Toby S.

description: Great to have a delicious Indian restaurant in the neighborhood. Full on a Thursday night!
author: Aaron F.

description: Best Indian food in SF! I am English and my girlfriend is Indian, we spent a long time trying to find really good Indian food here. I am so glad we did!
author: Sam L.

description: We finally tried Keeva Indian Kitchen last week.  The food was so fresh and it tasted very home made, which we hadn't really discovered with other Indian restaurants.  We ordered a spinach dish that was such a bright shade of green it seemed like they had just harvested the spinach!  And it was so delicious!  Everything was amazing.  I can't wait to eat there again.  Welcome to the neighborhood, Keeva!
author: Nikki C.

description: I had trouble finding an Indian restaurant that I really liked in SF; one that did the standard Northern dishes well.  I'm happy this place opened and is close to me.
author: Floyd B.

description: We are so delighted that this restaurant has come to our neighborhood. Clement Street is well known for having many terrific Asian options, but the addition of an Indian restaurant provides some welcome culinary diversity, and we went to try it with high hopes; we were thrilled by the food. We went with our 8 year old and found the place to be very friendly for children. We ordered Pakora, Chicken Curry Chetinad, Eggplant in Salan sauce, Dal Makhani, Vegetable Biryani, and a Mango Lassi. Every dish was fresh, interesting and delicious, and the eggplant was a particular favorite. I would recommend everything we ordered. The flavors were unique and distinct from other Indian dishes we have tried, and we have lived in many cities. The Lassi is the perfect size for a child, and was also very tasty. The service was prompt, but also friendly and relaxed, and the atmosphere was cozy and simple. It is the sort of place where the waitress might offer to hold your baby, and her daughter might stop by to say hello. We look forward to returning to try more dishes.
author: Maya V.

description: Disclaimer to the 2 stars: the food was very good, but our delivery experience was awful! We ordered a large order (naans, curry, biriyani, pakodas) on Friday evening and were really excited to try Keeva because of the great ratings and proximity to us. We ordered via ubereats. An hour later ubereats delivered someone else's order to us from Keeva! We called the restaurant to clarify and they admitted that there was an order switch during pickup. While they tried to help us get our original order back, neither uber nor the restaurant could help us. We had to end up eating some one else's food which was way spicier than we like it and far less in quantity than our original order. The 2 stars is because the restaurant mentioned on call that this kind of switcheroo has happened before. If this is the case, both uber and Keeva need to address the issue ASAP! Such a shame, because the food we ate, while spicy, was still really good!
author: Supriya G.
